title: Digitalt Ansvarig
description:
Hammarby Fotboll har de senaste åren utvecklat och förbättrat många delar av kommunikationsarbetet och den digitala närvaron. För att fortsätta på den resan söker vi nu en ny kollega som vill ta ansvar för våra digitala plattformar. Både i det tekniska och det strategiska arbetet med att driva, utveckla, underhålla och förbättra våra digitala möjligheter. Allt från hemsida, sociala medier till analys och CRM-plattform.
 



  





 Ditt uppdrag är att se till att tekniken bakom allt som syns och hörs är den bästa möjliga. Du kommer att ansvara för Hammarbys plattformar och digitala ekosystem, medan du får vassa kollegor som sköter innehållsproduktion, publicering och marknadsföring. I rollen ingår även att samordna externa digitala tjänster och arbeta nära de partners vi samarbetar med. Den här rollen är en del av marknads- och kommunikationsavdelningen och rapporterar direkt till Hammarby Fotbolls Marknadschef, men i det dagliga har du täta samarbeten och kontakter med hela organisationen samt externa partners.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag** 



* Ansvara för våra plattformar och hemsida – strategi, utveckling och drift
* Äga driva och utveckla insiktsarbete och analys samt CRM-plattform
* Se till att användarvänlighet och målgruppens behov alltid står i centrum
* Leda och samordna arbetet med interna utvecklare, externa byråer och partners
* Sätta mål, mäta beteenden och använda insikterna för kontinuerlig förbättring
* Bidra till utvecklingen av framtida digitala initiativ, som appar, video och e-handel
* Löpande undersöka nya möjligheter och förbättringar samt dela information inom organisationen



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi tror att du har mycket god teknisk förståelse, gillar struktur och problemlösning, och vill jobba i en miljö där du får ta stort eget ansvar. Du behöver inte kunna allt – men du behöver vara nyfiken, naturligt självgående, kommunikativ och trygg i att driva arbetet framåt självständigt. Du behöver inte vara expert på allt, det viktigaste är att du vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss och bidra till att skapa en stark digital upplevelse för alla som följer Hammarby.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har erfarenhet av att driva digitala projekt, både själv och tillsammans med andra
* Har en teknisk grundförståelse och kan sätta dig in i nya system och plattformar
* Har arbetat i CMS (gärna Sanity eller liknande), Google Analytics och med molnbaserade lösningar samt teknisk projektledning
* Har koll på video, innehållshantering, API:er, appar, GDPR och digital analys
* Trivs i en miljö där man jobbar nära andra, men också tar ansvar för sin egen leverans och utveckling
* Tidigare erfarenhet som produktägare eller teknisk projektledare (CMS/CRM)



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En viktig roll i en klubb som engagerar tusentals människor varje vecka
* Ett varmt arbetsklimat med kollegor som gillar att samarbeta
* Möjlighet att påverka, förbättra och bygga långsiktigt
* En arbetsplats där våra värderingar Gemenskap, Respekt & Kärlek är mer än bara ord



  





**Om processen** 




 Känns det här som din nästa utmaning så skicka in din ansökan direkt. Vi intervjuar löpande. Det här är en rekrytering via Digitalenta. Processen innehåller intervjuer, psykometriska tester samt arbetsprov.

title: Digital Design Lead (vikariat) till Kronans Apotek
description:
*Välkommen till vår värld! 👑 Vår vision är en värld som mår bra, och du kan hjälpa oss att göra den visionen verklig. Vi tror att meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, starka teamrelationer och en generös dos skratt skapar en arbetsmiljö som inspirerar och stärker oss och alla våra kunder. Med fokus på både här och nu, samt på framtiden - bidrar vi tillsammans till en värld som mår bra! 🌍🧡🚀*
 Som Digital Design Lead är ditt främsta uppdrag att skapa användarvänliga, tillgängliga och affärsdrivande digitala upplevelser. Det är en bred roll där du ansvarar för design inom e-handeln, både B2C och B2B, samt för interna system – i såväl webb som app.
   

  

 Du arbetar praktiskt med att ta fram koncept, prototyper och färdiga designlösningar, och samarbetar med våra utvecklare och andra intressenter i organisationen för att nå våra affärsmål, kundönskemål och designmål.
   

  

 Som e-handelsapotek har vi utmaningen i att vi måste förena design och sälj med regleringar och samhällsansvar. Som designer hos oss arbetar du med hela köpresan, från hantering av receptbelagda narkotikaklassade läkemedel till köp av hudvård och kosttillskott. Rollen kräver bredd, där du ofta är ensam designer med stort ansvar, men det ger också variation, frihet och möjlighet att påverka på riktigt.
   

  

 Och kanske viktigast av allt: du bidrar till samhällsnytta. Vi hjälper människor i vardagen, från småbarnsföräldrar till kroniskt sjuka,
   

  

**Exempel på dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Designa och förbättra användargränssnitt för webb, app och interna system
* Utföra användarresearch och usability-tester
* Genomföra tillgänglighetsanalyser och säkerställa att all ny design uppfyller tillgänglighetsdirektivet
* Utveckla och underhålla designsystem och riktlinjer
* Skapa wireframes och prototyper i Figma
* Samarbeta tätt med utvecklare för korrekt designimplementation
* Analysera användardata tillsammans med digitala analytiker för att optimera designlösningar
* Omvärldsbevaka trender inom design och usability


**Tjänsten är ett vikariat med start senast 24 november och en anställningsperiod på 14 månader.** 
 Du rapporterar till Daniel Bergman, Head of IT Development och välkomnas till vårt fina kontor i Stadshagen, Kungsholmen där vi tillämpar hybridarbete med minst 2 dagar i veckan på plats.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en stark känsla för användarupplevelse och affärsnytta, och som trivs i en roll där du får arbeta brett – från strategi och research till koncept och färdig design. Du är relationsbyggande och kommunikativ, med förmågan att samarbeta nära både utvecklare och intressenter. Du är lösningsorienterad och van att prioritera, kan identifiera vad som är en MVP och argumentera för dina designbeslut på ett tydligt och konstruktivt sätt.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

  

* 3–5 års erfarenhet av produktdesign för webb och app.
* Djup kunskap om tillgänglighet (WCAG 2.1 AA) och praktiskt tillgänglighetsarbete
* Expertis i Figma och andra design-/prototypverktyg
* Erfarenhet av användarcentrerad design och research
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande:
   

  

  

* Kunskaper inom microcopy.
* Erfarenhet från att arbeta med e-handel
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom Front-End-utveckling


**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
 Vad roligt att du är intresserad av att söka rollen hos oss! Vi vet att det kan kännas utmanande att söka jobb, särskilt i tider när konkurrensen är hög och många skickar in ansökningar. Samtidigt kan vi oftast bara välkomna en ny kollega per roll, vilket tyvärr innebär att flera starka kandidater inte går vidare – även om de har mycket att erbjuda.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att du ska känna dig trygg med hur processen går till. Vi vill därför vara öppna med hur vi gör vårt urval. Vi gör alltid en helhetsbedömning av ansökan. Självklart tittar vi på CV och erfarenheter, men det är inte det enda som spelar in. När vi rekryterar utgår vi från en tydlig kravprofil som vi delar i annonsen. Dina svar på urvalsfrågorna, och ibland även testresultat, vägs också in i vår bedömning. Vid många ansökningar kan just de delarna bli avgörande, så ta gärna lite extra tid att fylla i urvalsfrågorna noggrant innan du skickar in.
   

  

 Utöver detta tittar vi även på hur erfarenheter och kompetenser matchar det behov och sammanhang vi har i teamet just nu. På så sätt vill vi ge varje kandidat en så rättvis och transparent process som möjligt.
   

  

 I denna process efterfrågar vi även en portfolio vilket vägs in i bedömningen.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 I din ansökan vill vi ha ditt CV eller din LinkedInprofil samt din portfolio. Personligt brev? Det kan du skippa! Vi är intresserade av din kompetens, lära känna dig gör vi vid en eventuell intervju. I slutet av rekryteringsprocessen tillämpar vi en bakgrundskontroll på samtliga personer vi vill anställa, oavsett roll eller funktion. Då vi enbart tillämpar detta på slutkandidat informerar vi mer om det längre fram.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Kärnan inom Kronans Apotek handlar om att vi ska må bra tillsammans. När vi har meningsfulla uppgifter, omfamnar varandras olikheter och delar många skrattar kan vi göra stor skillnad tillsammans. Strävan om att må bra är något vi delar med våra fackliga parter och tillsammans arbetar vi för en värld som mår bra. För att komma i kontakt med facklig representant Gunilla Andersson, maila gunilla.andersson@kronansapotek.se alternativt Verdi Sawma, maila Verdi.Sawma@kronansapotek.se samt facklig representant Aisha Karimi från Sveriges Farmaceuter, maila af.kronan@sverigesfarmaceuter.se.*

title: Enhetsassistent till Arbetsmarknadsdepartementet
description:
Har du flera års erfarenhet av administration inom statsförvaltningen och är service-, kvalitets- och utvecklingsinriktad? Då är du kanske rätt person för en spännande administrativ roll i en variationsrik miljö i händelsernas centrum.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som enhetsadministratör kommer du att ansvara för förvaltning och hantering av enhetens interna administration. En del av din vardag kommer att vara hantering av ärenden, samordning av enhetens praktiska planering, praktiskt genomförande av olika interna och externa möten samt att tillse och följa upp att rutiner följs och regler efterlevs. Du bistår enhetschefen och handläggarna i det dagliga arbetet med t.ex. beredningsprocessen och expediering av beslut m.m. samt ansvarar för kontakt med registrator vad gäller frågor om registrering och arkivering av pågående och avslutade ärenden.
   

  

 Du deltar och bidrar aktivt i utvecklingen av enhetens administrativa rutiner samt bidrar med ditt perspektiv, din kompetens och dina idéer. För oss är det viktigt att dra lärdom av erfarenheter, våga tänka om och testa nytt. Du utgör ett proaktivt stöd i rollen som utvecklare och expert på Regeringskansliets och departementets administrativa rutiner och arbetsmoment i digitala verktyg och stöd. Rollen innefattar också att i viss utsträckning biträda handläggare i beredning av ärenden inom enhetens politikområden, nämligen arbetet mot diskriminering, som även rymmer arbete mot rasism och liknande former av fientlighet och insatser för hbtqi-personers lika rättigheter och möjligheter, samt samordning och utveckling av arbetet med mänskliga rättigheter på nationell nivå.
   

  

 Ditt arbete präglas av ett fortlöpande och nära samarbete med övriga administratörer på departementet. Du ingår i departementets administratörsnätverk där administratörerna vid behov går in och täcker för varandra. Du har även fortlöpande dialog med såväl kollegor inom enheten och departementet som med andra departement och myndigheter.
   

  

**Din bakgrund.** 
 För att axla denna roll krävs det att du har avslutad gymnasieutbildning kombinerad med flerårig aktuell erfarenhet av kvalificerat administrativt arbete som liknar denna roll hos oss från Regeringskansliet eller annan statlig förvaltning. Du har även erfarenhet av att utveckla administrativa rutiner och arbetssätt. Vidare har du mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift, samt IT-verktyg, inklusive Officepaketet och Adobe Acrobat.
   

  

 Det är meriterande med relevant eftergymnasial utbildning, goda kunskaper i SharePoint (DHS) och andra digitala verktyg som används i Regeringskansliet. Det är även meriterande med mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper.** 
 I din roll som administratör är du van att arbeta proaktivt, där du tar egna initiativ. Som medarbetare i Regeringskansliet tar du ansvar för utveckling genom att utveckla ditt medarbetarskap, att aktivt medverka till utveckling av verksamhet och arbetsmiljö genom att snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer, kompromissa, hantera förändringar och nya utmaningar med smidighet. Som medarbetare i Regeringskansliet tar du ansvar för helhet genom att bidra aktivt med ditt perspektiv, din kompetens och dina idéer samt efterfråga andras perspektiv. Du bidrar till att det administrativa stödet som helhet fungerar genom att organisera och prioritera väl. Som medarbetare tar du ansvar för resultat genom att driva processer framåt på ett självständigt sätt som bidrar till att lösa olika frågor och problemställningar av skiftande karaktär. Du har hög integritet och ett mycket gott omdöme.
   

  

 Du gillar att ge service, är noggrann och säkerställer kvaliteten i ditt arbete. Du bidrar till att det administrativa stödet som helhet fungerar mycket väl. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Övrigt.** 
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. En säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta enhetschef Jenny Olausson på 08-405 12 57. Du är även välkommen att kontakta rekryteringsspecialist Marjut Thelin. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Lina Konradsen för Saco samt Åsa Bergqvist för ST. Samtliga nås via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast 1 okt, 2025
 **.**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Arbetsmarknadsdepartementet ansvarar för frågor och ärenden som rör arbetsmarknad, arbetsrätt och arbetsmiljö. Departementet ansvarar också för integrationsfrågor, arbetet mot utanförskap och arbetet för ökad jämställdhet mellan kvinnor och män. Dessutom ansvarar departementet för arbetet för mänskliga rättigheter på nationell nivå, att stärka hbtqi-personers rättigheter samt arbetet mot rasism och diskriminering.

title: Senior Javautvecklare - Financial Services
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du vass på utveckling och vill få möjligheten att förändra och förbättra samhället vi lever i? Du gillar att jobba i grupp och gillar att leda andra utvecklare. Nu söker vi en senior Java-utvecklare till vårt team inom Financial Services i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som konsult och utvecklare på CGI kommer du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden. Vårt arbetssätt bygger på närhet och långsiktiga kundrelationer. Vi vill vara våra kunders innovativa och proaktiva partner som hjälper dem att nå framgång i sin verksamhet. Vi erbjuder en spännande roll med nära samarbeten samt varierande och utvecklande arbetsuppgifter. Inom våra åtaganden strävar vi efter en miljö där vi stöttar varandra och har roligt på dagarna.
   

  

 Om du tycker att detta låter spännande så tveka inte att söka!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som senior Java-utvecklare kommer dina ansvarsområden att vara:
   

  

* Analys, systemdesign, utveckling och implementation av system och lösningar.
* Dokumentation i olika former.
* Dela kunskap med dina kollegor.
* Testarbete för att kvalitetssäkra leveranser till kund.
* Arbeta åt flera olika kunder och miljöer för att kontinuerligt utvecklas.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst 5+ års erfarenhet av utveckling i Java och har erfarenhet av agil systemutvecklingsmetodik. För den här tjänsten behöver du även behärska svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift samt ha svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har kompetens inom något av följande:
   

  

* Java
* Kubernetes
* Grafana
* Kafka
* Apache Avro
* Postgre SQL
* Solution Design
* ISO20022


 Du kommer att bli en viktig del i ett av våra team inom Financial Services. Vi ser att du är en teamspelare som både kan ge och ta i tekniska diskussioner såväl som förslag på lösningar. Vi ser också att det finns en vilja och nyfikenhet att lära sig nya saker, inte minst på teknisk nivå. Du är lyhörd och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kundens behov och hitta lämpliga lösningar.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Jennie Arneving på jennie.arneving@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: WPF Expert, Lund
description:
Job Title
WPF Expert, Lund
Job Description*Vill du jobba med varierande uppgifter i alla delar av* *utvecklingsprocessen?* *Fortsätt då att läsa. Vi på Axis Communications söker fler .net utvecklare som vill arbeta med innovativa lösningar till vår marknadsledande verksamhet inom bland annat nätverksvideo.*
Ditt framtida team  

Teamet består idag av tre mjukvaruutvecklare och en QA-ingenjör. Vi värdesätter teamarbete och jobbar agilt med mycket parprogrammering och kontinuerliga delleveranser.
Varje dag börjar med ett stand up möte där retrospektiv och interna reflektioner hör till de vanliga rutinerna.
Vi är övertygade om att självgående team där alla individer blir hörda är grunden för en innovativ arbetskultur. Always open är en av våra viktigaste värderingar, vilket för oss innebär att vi lyssnar på och värdesätter alla idéer för att förbättra och skapa bra lösningar för slutanvändaren. Vi anser också att beslut så långt som möjligt ska fattas av den eller de personer som berörs av beslutet.
Vad du kommer att göra som .Net utvecklare  

Du kommer att vara delaktig i att ta fram end-to-end lösningen som knyter ihop slutanvändare med vårt växande utbud av kameror och hårdvara. Tillsammans med ditt team kommer du att utveckla Axis eget VMS; AXIS Camera Station, som vi skriver i C#.
Läs gärna mer här: https://www.axis.com/products/axis-camera-station-pro
Vem är du?  

Som person är du driven, ansvarstagande och hittar innovativa lösningar för att bidra till vår utveckling framåt. Vi gillar att utmana och bli utmanade, så var redo att tänka utanför boxen!

På Axis erbjuder vi möjligheten att arbeta med erfarna kollegor i en global miljö med många möjligheter. För oss är din framtida karriär och utveckling viktig.
Vår företagskultur är central – där jämställdhet, laganda och att ha roligt är nyckeln! Vi vill att du ska trivas hos oss och därför erbjuder vi förmåner som flexibla arbetstider, morgonfika, fredagkaka, bonusprogram, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukförsäkring och din alldeles egna Axis-cykel, för att nämna några.
Redo att söka?  

Låter detta som det du söker? Vi går igenom urvalet löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!  

Har du några frågor eller vill höra mer om rollen kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Guillermo Sagastume på 046 272 1800.

title: Thesis opportunity- Designing for Seamless AI Integration
description:
How can AI be integrated into industrial user interfaces in a way that feels natural, intuitive, and unobtrusive?



This thesis explores how AI can support users in machine vision environments without drawing attention to itself. No “AI” buttons, no flashy automations, instead, the focus is on subtle, context-aware design that enhances the user experience while keeping the interface familiar and efficient.



The work will be based on UI/UX research and investigate how AI-driven features (such as tool suggestions, adaptive settings, or contextual help) can be embedded into existing workflows. The goal is to make AI feel like a natural part of the interface, something users benefit from without necessarily realizing it’s AI.



Possible questions to explore:


* How can AI-driven features be surfaced without disrupting the user’s flow?
* How can contextual cues be used to trigger AI support naturally?
* How can AI help users discover the advanced features through subtle, context-aware hints?
* How can seamless AI integration improve onboarding and usability for non-expert users?
* What are users’ perceptions of AI when it’s not explicitly labeled as such?
* What evaluation methods best measure the effectiveness of such solutions


**Prerequisites**



You should have a general interest in user interface and user experience design, and some experience with prototyping or front-end development. A basic understanding of image processing and machine vision concepts is valuable, and familiarity with AI technologies, such as image-based inference, prompt-driven interaction, or intelligent tool suggestions is beneficial. Most importantly, you should be curious about how to design intuitive interfaces that make AI feel like a natural part of the user experience.

  


**Contact**



For more information about the position, contact:



John Stynsberg, Software Developer, john.stynsberg@sick.se



or



Sarah Lantz, HR Business Partner, +46 739 10 99 37.


**We warmly welcome your application — please submit it no later than October 26th.**


*SICK is a world-leading supplier of sensors and sensor solutions for industrial applications.* *We’re part of SICK AG — a global leader in sensor technology with 10,000 employees across 50 countries and headquarters in Freiburg, Germany. Together, we build technology that makes industries more efficient, intelligent, and safe.*


*As a Machine Vision Innovation Center, SICK Linköping develops* *high-performance cameras and* *advanced AI-powered software that drives the future of both manufacturing and logistics automation. Whether it’s helping robots pick the right item or enabling high-precision quality control with 2D and 3D vision, our solutions bring clarity, speed, and smart decision-making to complex industrial environments — all driven by a dedicated team of 100 colleagues.*


*We are very proud of being a healthy and attractive workplace. We have consistently been recognized as one of the best workplaces in Sweden according to the Great Place to Work survey. We actively work to reduce our climate footprint and engage in various initiatives to contribute to society and enhance diversity at our workplace.*

title: Powertrain Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Do you want to help develop the powertrains of the future for heavy vehicles and industry?**



At Sigma Industry West, we see a growing demand for experienced engineers with expertise in powertrain – and we are now looking for you who want to take part in designing the powertrains of tomorrow.



With us, you’ll work in project-based assignments, either at the customer’s site or at our in-house operations in Lindholmen, focusing on the development of powertrains, transmissions, and engines (ICE, PHEV, BEV).



As a Powertrain Engineer, you will play a key role in development projects within industrial and marine applications as well as heavy-duty vehicles.



Your work may include design, component responsibility, or, in some cases, technical project management. The projects vary in scope and content – but what they all have in common is close collaboration with our customers, often in an international context. We offer a flexible work environment based at our friendly office in Lindholmen – with a focus on sustainable transport solutions, technical development, and your continued professional growth.



**WE´RE LOOKING FOR YOU WITH**



* B.Sc. / M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development, or similar
* At least 3 years of experience in design (or assignment/project management within powertrain and engine development)
* Experience in designing with CREO
* A strong interest in technology


**MERITS:**



* Experience with heavy-duty vehicles
* LNG & alternative fuels for ICE
* Experience with KOLA, GCR, or working with international suppliers
* Proficiency in Swedish, spoken and written


You are a communicative and collaborative person who quickly adapts to new conditions and customer needs. You thrive in a dynamic environment, are highly driven, and motivated by learning and taking on new challenges. We are looking for someone solution-oriented, committed, and positive, who contributes to a great work atmosphere. Cross-functional collaboration is something you both value and have experience with.



**WHO ARE WE?**



As a consultant at Sigma Industry West, you get the best of both worlds: the variety and development of consulting – with the security of a stable, long-term employer. We provide cutting-edge expertise in areas like Product Development, UX & Design, PLM, Industrial IT, Production Technology, and Project Management. Your assignment may be at the client site or from our vibrant in-house office located in the heart of Lindholmen Science Park.



We believe in doing things together and value a healthy mix of work and fun – from afterworks, events, and workouts to ski trips and inspirational talks. We've taken many exciting trips together and just recently returned from South Africa(!) where we celebrated our 10th anniversary as a consultancy firm.



Competence development has always been a priority for us. In addition to learning in your assignments and various technical trainings, we offer internal programs for personal growth.



We also believe that autonomy, involvement, and influence are key to achieving your personal goals. Our employees have chosen us because we share this view on career, life, and development. To us, who you are is just as important as what you do. Our ambition is to help you grow and evolve into something great – together with our clients.



**SIGMA GROUP**



As part of Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds: entrepreneurial spirit and long-term stability.



We’re the smaller company within the larger Sigma network – a group of companies with specialized expertise across different engineering fields. Today, we are over 5,000 employees in 14 countries, making us Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Simon Karlsson,  

simon.karlsson@sigma.se

title: Product Designer
description:
**About us**

  

Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

 **The Role**


We're looking for a Product Designer (UX focus) for the Growth team at Soundtrack. They’re a key part of our growth efforts and responsible for designing user experiences that convert visitors into paying customers.


The team’s mission is to drive new paying customers by creating a seamless journey through soundtrack.io, our sign-up flow, and onboarding process. This role will complement our existing UI designer by bringing stronger UX expertise, ensuring we deeply understand our users’ needs and translate them into effective, inspiring product experiences.

**In practice, this means:**

* Regularly creating flows, wireframes, prototypes and testing them with users and data.
* Working closely with developers, analysts, our PM and our UI designer to deliver impactful solutions.
* Using Figma and data-driven design methods to iterate quickly and continuously improve.

  

**Responsibilities**

  

* Drive the design process from idea to implemented solution.
* Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and design concepts in Figma.
* Collaborate with engineers, analysts, and other designers to deliver high-quality experiences.
* Work data-driven: plan and evaluate experiments, analyze results, and iterate on solutions.
* Contribute to Soundtrack’s design community and help shape our shared design principles.

  

**About You**


Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.

**Requirements**

  

* 3–5+ years of professional experience as a product designer or UX designer.
* Strong UX skills with the ability to explore user needs, design flows, and prototypes.
* Experience collaborating with UI designers or taking designs from concept to delivery.
* Proficiency in Figma.
* Comfortable working in a data-driven and experiment-oriented environment.
* Strong self-leadership, initiative and collaboration skills.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken.
  

**Beneficial Requirements**

* Experience working in SaaS, start-up or scale-up environments.
* Familiarity with growth teams, B2B products or subscription models.
* Experience working closely with analysts and running A/B tests.

**Employee Benefits**

* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office
  
* 

At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.


We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: UX Design Lead
description:

 We’re seeking an experienced UX Design Lead to drive the transformation of the
   

  

 user experience across our platform, with the design system as the core enabler.
   

  

 You will scale and evolve the system to be future-proof in an AI-driven product
   

  

 environment, grounded in user needs and research, ensuring it empowers both UX
   

  

 and engineering teams to deliver cohesive, consistent, and scalable experiences.
   

  

 This role requires strong leadership in systems thinking, user experience, and design
   

  

 systems, along with a deep interest in AI-enhanced product experiences. You will
   

  

 champion adoption across the organization, aligning stakeholders and enabling
   

  

 teams to design with speed, consistency, and quality.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead the transformation of the user experience across the platform, with the


 design system as the enabler.
   

  

* Own, evolve, and govern the design system based on user needs and


 research, ensuring cohesive, consistent, and scalable experiences.
   

  

* Facilitate cross-functional collaboration, running workshops and alignment

 using tools like Cursor and Storybook.

 Advocate for user-centered design practices informed by research, data, and
   

  

 insights.

 3 years in a design leadership role.
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in design or equivalent.

 digital products.
   

  

* Experienced practitioner of Design Thinking methodology (double diamond)

 teams across multiple locations.
   

  

* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to align stakeholders and


 translate complex technical concepts into business value.
   

  

* Good analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven approach.

 workflows.
   

  

 You get extra points if you have:
   

  

* Experience designing AI-native software or developing AI based automations.

* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and


 strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed
   

  

 to accelerating sustainable transformation in fashion.

* A collaborative and innovative work environment where your ideas and


 contributions are valued.
   

  

* The chance to make a significant impact on the future of fashion and retail


 through technology.

TrusTrace is leading global-scale traceability programs for many of the world’s largest brands. The company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with additional offices in India, France and the US.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* The opportunity to drive change and break new grounds to enhance and strengthen the visual identity of a growing global scale-up company, committed to accelerate sustainable transformation in fashion.
* To be part of a great multicultural, multilingual team.

title: Product Domain Lead (Temporary Assignment/Consultancy Opportunity)
description:
**Temporary Assignment/Consultancy Opportunity** 
*Product Leaders out there, we have a longer temporary assignment open as of mid October to August 2026. We welcome both independent consultants and consultancy firms to present candidates for this role. We also want to emphasize that we care deeply about diversity. We strongly encourage consultancy partners to reflect this in their submissions, i.e., at least present candidates out of gender diversity.*
 At Hemnet, we don’t just build products - we shape the way people find their future homes. Now, we’re on the lookout for a Product Domain Lead to join us on a temporary assignment/consultancy basis and help drive one of our most exciting product domains forward. This role isn’t just about strategy on paper - it’s about inspiring teams, leading change, and making an impact that moves the needle for our company and our customers. Your leadership will shape how we grow, evolve, and set the standard for innovation in our business.
   

  

 🌟
 **What you’ll do**
 As our Product Domain Lead, you’ll be the visionary who not only defines the strategy for your domain but also sets the metrics that truly move the business forward. You’ll have the chance to inspire and grow leaders - guiding Product Managers to unlock their potential and tackle complex challenges with confidence.
   

  

 You’ll be a connector, building strong bridges across teams and functions to ensure collaboration flows seamlessly and results land with real impact. With curiosity and courage, you’ll encourage experimentation, champion data-driven decisions, and dare to push boundaries to find smarter, better ways of working.
   

  

 And through it all, you’ll keep the team focused on what matters most - clearing the path, setting priorities, and ensuring we deliver outcomes (
 *action over perfection* 
 ) that make a meaningful difference for Hemnet and our customers.
   

  

 🧩
 **What makes you the right fit**
* You’ve led other Product Managers (at least 3+ year in a domain-like structure).
* You’ve navigated complexity in a product organization spanning consumer-facing and partner-led products.
* You’re a curious and courageous leader who tunes in, and thrives on inspiring change.
* B2B experience? Even better - you’ll know how to spot what should stay, what should go, and what new ideas are worth launching.


**A note to Consultancy companies** 
 ☝🏽
   

  

 Present from a diversity perspective and do not forget candidate availability (open to start when) and hourly cost.
   

  

 If any questions, please contact julia.maric@hemnet.se

title: User Experience Researcher (Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

 Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel
   

  

 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

 We have only scratched the surface. The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. Our aim is to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

 Work in the heart of Asia. This is an amazing opportunity if you're looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

 This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.
   

  

 UX Researchers own end-to-end planning, execution, analysis and reporting of research projects, and consistently achieve research outputs needed by Product teams to inform strategic decisions. The research findings of UX Researchers impact Agoda's business success by informing Product teams regarding design or design process, end user experience, product direction, market strategy or similar.
   

  

 Qualifications:
   

  

* Master Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field
* 7+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains
* You are very comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research
* Experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Experience with Quantitative research (metrics, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data
* You are able to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests
* You are a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, designers, engineers and other stakeholders (in English)
* You enjoy collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven and creative environment


 Responsibilities:
   

  

 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Demonstrates critical thinking beyond explicit business requests
* Functions independently in all operational research tasks
* Leads core end-to-end research activities - including driving research objectives, hypotheses, methodology, execution, analysis, and communication


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Good judgement when evaluating research opportunities, e.g. importance, urgency, and impact for team
* Ability to reasonably challenge details of research requests, and propose solid research solutions
* Strong project execution with existing skills while constantly expanding his/her breadth and depth of abilities
* Knowledge of approaches for both quantitative and qualitative research, effectively triangulating findings, methods, and theories with others
* Application of tools and inspection methods to quantify the value and efficiency of research
* Ability to adopt and adapt well-established methods according to product/project situations, and innovate new methods in collaboration with more senior researchers
* Knowledge of or ability to quickly learn key software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis)
* Knowledge of data compliance and ethics in all of their activities


 Collaboration & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross-discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines, with clear commitments in case of shared ownership
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills; tailors communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to taking input and feedback


 Research Community Contributions:
   

  

* Contributes to the research community in one or more ways - sharing work/ methodologies, coaching and/or mentoring other core or junior researchers, screening of Research candidates


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

 Disclaimer
   

  

 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Product Manager
description:
*We Care, We Challenge, We Commit, We Collaborate* 




 Join Scrive and be part of an international, fast-growing company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Collaborate with smart, caring, and driven colleagues across Europe as we shape the Scrive story. 🚀
 



  





 As part of our growing product organisation, you’ll join a diverse and collaborative team working on solutions that make a real difference in our customers’ daily operations.
 



  





 We work in cross-functional teams
 *(squads)* 
 and use modern tools like Productboard, Figma, and Pendo.io. You’ll report to the
 **Group Product Manager** 
 and work closely with engineering, product design, and go-to-market teams. We're looking for someone based in
 **Stockholm** 
 ,
 **Copenhagen, Berlin, Amsterdam** 
 or
 **Brno.** 




  





**The opportunity** 




 We are looking for a motivated and structured
 **Product Manager for Integrations** 
 to take ownership of a growing portfolio of native integrations that connect our platform with the tools our customers use every day.
 



  





 These include CRM systems like Salesforce and HubSpot, document management tools like SharePoint and Google Drive, and workflow tools like Microsoft Power Automate.
 



  





 In this role, you will:
 


* Own and manage the roadmap for our native integration portfolio.
* Work closely with customers and commercial teams to identify integration needs and pain points, and drive the development of new standard integrations.
* Define requirements and collaborate with engineering to scope and deliver new integration features.
* Support go-to-market teams with product documentation, training, and launch readiness.
* Maintain and improve existing integrations, balancing tech quality and usability.
* Collaborate with internal teams on packaging, pricing, and positioning of integrations.
* Track integration usage and gather feedback to guide continuous improvement.
* Collaborate with external consultancy firms that build and maintain selected outsourced integrations, ensuring quality, alignment, and timely delivery.



  





**What we're looking for** 




 You don’t need to have all the answers on day one, but we’re looking for someone curious, structured, and eager to grow. Ideally, you bring:
 


* 1–3 years of experience in a product-related role (e.g. Product Manager, Product Owner, Business Analyst)
* An understanding of SaaS platforms and B2B user needs
* Experience working with APIs, integrations, or workflow tools is a strong plus
* Strong collaboration and communication skills
* A structured approach to discovery, documentation, and decision-making
* Fluency in English (Nordic languages, German or Dutch are a plus)



  





**Why join us?** 



* Join a fast-growing Nordic SaaS company with real impact
* Work on meaningful products that integrate deeply with customer workflows
* Learn and grow alongside experienced product managers and cross-functional teams
* Enjoy a collaborative culture, flexible work environment, and a strong sense of purpose



  





*Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway! Studies show that women and people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At Scrive, we value diverse perspectives and encourage anyone who is excited about this role to apply.*

title: Senior Product Manager - Website and Acquisition
description:
Intro
   

  

 At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.
   

  

 Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation - which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our PLG team, focusing on our website and customer acquisition. In this role, you'll be the brain behind our website's strategy and own the execution of product as an acquisition channel. You'll optimise the funnel to drive conversion for our PLG motion as well as effectively qualify high-intent leads for our sales team. If you're excited about owning a high-impact website that serves both PLG and sales-led motions and are passionate about experimentation, data-driven decisions, and the future of Fin-tech, then this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Please note: We are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role in any of the listed locations you find in the job info.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a Senior Product Manager, you will:
   

  

* Lead the website strategy and roadmap to serve both our Product-Led Growth (PLG) and Sales-Led motions, optimizing the funnel from first visit to signup
* Define the strategy and own the execution of product as an acquisition channel (e.g., free tools), leveraging product experiences to generate high-quality leads
* Deeply analyse user behaviour using data from analytics platforms and qualitative research to identify friction points and opportunities for improvement
* Design and execute experiments to optimise conversion rates, lead qualification, across the website and acquisition funnel.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and other product teams to ensure a seamless user experience and effective lead handover
* Develop strategies to increase lead education on the website, ensuring customers have a higher intent and a better understanding of Pleo's value proposition upon signup
* Optimise for SEO/GEO and technical health, working closely with engineering and marketing to ensure the website is both high-performing and easily discoverable
* Manage complex stakeholder relationships, balancing requests to deliver a cohesive and high-performing website experience


 What you bring
   

  

 You’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* Exceptional stakeholder management skills and the ability to navigate complex situations with multiple, often competing, priorities
* Extensive experience with experimentation frameworks (A/B testing) and a data-driven mindset for validating hypotheses
* A strong analytical acumen and proficiency in data analysis tools like Google Analytics, Amplitude, and SQL
* Proven product management experience in a Website team that has served both PLG and Sales-Led motions. PLG motion experience is a hard requirement, while sales-led motions is a plus!
* Deep customer empathy and proven experience conducting user research to translate insights into tangible product improvements
* Strong business acumen with an understanding of SaaS business models, unit economics, and how a website drives revenue
* A passion for solving problems in a creative and innovative way


 Who you’ll be working with and reporting to
   

  

 You’ll report to our PLG Director and work closely with teams within PLG, our GTM functions like Marketing, Rev Ops, Sales, as well as closely with other Product teams. Our team of 8 is highly collaborative and dedicated to Growth.
   

  

 How you’ll develop in this role
   

  

 In your first 3 months at Pleo, you’ll:
   

  

* Lead the Website strategy definition for both self-serve and our sales-led motion to drive impact in our company acquisition efforts
* Collaborate with Product Marketing to improve the positioning of product as a way to increase lead education launching rapid, hypothesis-driven experiments
* Grow your skills, taking on new challenges as the company continues to scale


 We’re committed to helping you develop your career, whether that means taking on bigger projects, stepping into leadership, or acquiring new skills in Product Led Growth.
   

  

 Show me the benefits!
   

  

* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
* Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Product Design Leadership(Bangkok-Based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

 Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel
   

  

 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

 Getting to know our Agoda Design Team
   

  

 Embark on a journey with the Agoda Design Team, a vibrant community of product designers crafting innovative solutions from the heart of Bangkok, Thailand, and Gurugram, India. As a pivotal force in our product-driven company, we collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to unravel customer challenges, shaping workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. Whether you're honing your craft, expanding your skillset, or stepping into a leadership role, now is the time to join a team that's both scrappy and hands-on yet influential enough to drive change and shape product strategy. Be a part of Agoda's Design team and contribute to unlocking the world for our global community of travelers.
   

  

 The Product Design Leader at Agoda is responsible for:
   

  

 As a Product Design Leader at Agoda, you will oversee product design teams across a variety of business areas. You will be responsible for setting and executing the design vision, building high-performing teams, and ensuring design excellence and consistency across all touchpoints. This role is flexible and may be assigned to lead design for different product verticals as business needs evolve.
   

  

 You will manage and mentor Product Design Leads, Managers, and senior designers, and work closely with cross-functional partners in Product, Technology, and Business to drive impact at scale.
   

  

 In this Role, you’ll get to:
   

  

* Design Strategy & Execution: Define and implement the product design strategy for assigned product areas (consumer, supply, enterprise, or internal tools), ensuring alignment with Agoda’s global design principles, usability, accessibility, and design system standards
* Team Leadership: Build, manage, and inspire a diverse team of Product Design Leads, Managers, and Senior Designers. Foster a culture of growth, inclusion, and high performance
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Product, Technology, and Design leaders to align on strategy, drive execution, and maximize the impact and ROI of design
* Design Systems & Consistency: Champion the adoption and evolution of Agoda’s Design Systems, ensuring consistency and quality across all products and platforms
* Talent Development: Mentor and develop design talent, supporting career growth and building a thriving design community
* Product Roadmap Influence: Contribute to and help shape product roadmaps, balancing short-term delivery with long-term vision
* Performance & Impact: Set and track KPIs for design teams, reporting on performance and business impact
* Advocacy: Be a passionate advocate for user-centered design, bringing cross-functional partners into the research and design process


 What you’ll Need to Succeed:
   

  

* 10+ years of design and UX leadership experience in high-traffic digital products (100,000+ daily users), ideally in e-commerce, marketplaces, or product-driven companies
* Proven experience leading and scaling design teams of 30+ people, including managers and senior ICs
* Strong people management, team development, recruiting, and organizational building skills
* Deep expertise in product design, design systems, and building end-to-end experiences in complex environments
* Track record of setting vision, strategy, and roadmaps, and aligning teams with business goals
* Experience driving cross-functional collaboration and influencing at the executive level
* Data-driven and strategic, with a strong ability to balance long-term vision with short- and medium-term goals
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


 It’s Great if you have:
   

  

* Experience in OTAs, e-commerce or product driven companies
* Experience managing Designer Managers & Principle level designers
* Experience in driving strategy & influencing product roadmaps
* Experience with utilization AI across design org operations, product output


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

 Disclaimer
   

  

 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

**As Senior Product Manager for our women's wear woven category at our Stockholm Office,** 
 you will lead a team driving product development, ensuring quality, cost-efficiency and delivery across collections. The role requires strong leadership, supplier collaboration, sustainability and production excellence.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

**As Senior Product Manager for our women's wear woven category** 
 your main contribution will be to drive the product development process to meet business goals. You will report to RTW Development Director.
   

  

 You will play a vital role in ensuring commercially successful and well-executed collections by:
   

  

* Leading the material and development process in line with company standards and business goals for desirability, quality, cost, sustainability and delivery
* Having responsibility for style allocation between factories to ensure the highest possible standard of make while achieving target CMT and FOB prices in accordance with the collection's price range
* Leading and reviewing fittings sessions, provide proactive and focused input to ensure quality and fit
* Managing the costing process and analysis of margins and deciding on negotiation strategies towards suppliers to ensure we achieve company targets in alignment with the development director RTW
* Working on development strategies in relation to suppliers and business objectives in alignment with the Development Director
* Leading, motivating and developing direct reports


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Balanced leader with strong social skills
* Efficient, organized and have the ability to work in a fast paced environment
* An action oriented attitude with a proactive approach to problem solving
* Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships both internally and externally


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree, from fashion and or textile education
* Minimum 7 years’ experience in a RTW product development role preferably from high-end fashion brands
* Previous managerial experience
* Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English
* Highly proficient in MS Office applications, particularly Excel
* Strong pricing and negotiating skills


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Nordics Lead
description:
**Job Description**
 At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture, and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
   

  

 Since Canva’s launch in August 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing 220 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 15 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Canva’s International Team is a diverse & distributed team of content specialists, marketers and growth teams who drive user growth, brand awareness, and affinity in our key international markets. You’ll partner closely with leads across the International Supergroup to build and implement a comprehensive multi-year strategy for user and revenue growth goals for your market. You will work with local, regional and central teams including Marketing, Growth, Product, Partnerships, Content, SEO, Education, Community, Sales, NFP, PR, Finance & Strategy.
   

  

 What you’ll work on...
   

  

* Strategy. Act as the main POC and be responsible for overall user and revenue growth in your country. You'll bring together local and global teams across marketing, sales, product, content and finance to create and execute a cohesive multi-year growth strategy, and own the KPIs including MAUs and ARR.
* Localisation. Work closely with the regional team to optimise our product, content, pricing and packaging to meet the needs of local users, informed by a deep understanding of local market dynamics and cultural nuances across a range of audiences, including knowledge workers, SMBs, students, startup ecosystems, NGOs, and other emerging sectors.
* Leadership. Inspire, drive and in some cases coach the in-market team, ensuring a high quality bar for impact and working closely with local speciality leads on performance management.
* Budget. Partner closely with the regional team and marketing lead to shape the marketing strategy and deployment of budget.
* Public face. Represent Canva as a local figurehead across press, PR, events and community, as required.
* Sponsorship. Build and support high value relationships by acting as a local sponsor for enterprise sales, education, government, partnerships, etc.


 You’re probably a match if you are...
   

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English (written and spoken)
* Strongly entrepreneurial, with founder-style appetite for growing something big from a small start and working across everything from education to press.
* Experienced building a market, for example as the regional GM or brand lead for a global SaaS company, or as a proven founder or growth lead in a startup.
* Keenly analytical. Deeply focused on KPIs and obsessive about driving actionable insights from disparate datasets.
* Product oriented, with passion for improving the experience of users and the ability to translate these insights into product requirements.
* Publicity savvy, with experience doing public speaking and acting as a public face to the press and other stakeholders.
* Well networked, ideally with routes into some combination of government departments, corporates, influencers, journalists and local talent.
* A proven leader, able to grow, inspire, and coach high-performing teams. You have high emotional intelligence and empathy, and are a deeply collaborative teammate.
* A strong communicator, fully proficient in spoken and written English, and with the interpersonal skills to influence global and local stakeholders.
* Values aligned. Genuinely excited by Canva’s mission and deeply aligned with our values, and with exceptional references to prove it.


**Additional Information**
 We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.
   

  

 Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

title: AI Expert
description:
**Are you passionate about deploying AI at scale and shaping the digital future?
   

  

 Join us in a strategic role where you'll architect and scale advanced AI solutions that go beyond prototypes — driving real-world transformation across customer experience and operational efficiency.**
**About The Team**
 Telenor Sweden is scaling its AI ambitions through the newly launched AI Center of Acceleration, and we are looking for an AI Expert to the Analytics Architecture & AI Automation Team who thrives at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and business impact.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who can identify business pain points and translate them into AI-powered solutions, leveraging a bleeding-edge tech stack to drive innovation. You will work hands-on with GCP Vertex AI, AI agents and other modern data platforms to help business teams explore, experiment, and adopt AI in meaningful ways.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, you will collaborate with various departments across Telenor Sweden to identify challenges and design AI solutions that address real-world problems using advanced tools and techniques. You will develop prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI, providing stakeholders with a clear understanding of what is possible.
   

  

 A key part of your work will involve creating scalable AI and ML pipelines, as well as agent-based solutions, utilizing technologies such as Google Agent Development Kit and Vertex AI. This enables rapid experimentation and quick deployment of AI capabilities across the organization. You will build ML solutions using Python, PyTorch, and Hugging Face, while also gaining hands-on experience working in cloud environments (GCP), containers, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
   

  

 Additionally, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of responsible AI practices and governance frameworks, ensuring that the use of AI technology aligns with ethical standards and promotes sustainable innovation.
   

  

**What Is In It For You**
 Step into a strategic role where you’ll be at the forefront of AI adoption across Telenor Sweden. This is your chance to work on solutions that move beyond the lab—deployed in production and driving real impact for customers and internal operations alike. You’ll have direct influence on how AI reshapes digital experiences, all while collaborating in a forward-thinking environment backed by global expertise. And with continuous learning through Telenor Academy and dedicated training programs, your growth won’t just be encouraged—it’ll be expected.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for you with the following skills:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Strong programming skills in Python (at least 5+ years of experience); familiarity with Java or JavaScript is a plus.
* Concepts around RAG architecture and governance
* Experience with GCP, especially Vertex AI, and ideally AWS. (at least 2+ years of experience)
* Interest in LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Gemini, Anthropic), AI agents, and searchable AI.
* Familiarity with data visualization, API integration, and MLOps.
* A proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and a focus on user experience.
* Excellent communication skills primarily in English. Swedish is a plus.


**Apply today!** 
  

  

 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.  Last application date is 30th of September 2025.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager adeel.anwar@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
   

  

**Our promise to you** 
  

  

**We are better together.** 
  

  

 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.** 
  

  

 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.** 
  

  

 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.** 
  

  

 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know** 
  

  

 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Head of Online
job_function: Product Management, Business Development, and Management
description:
**Stronger together - Join our team** 




 As one of the top companies for payment solutions in the Nordic region, we offer a stimulating and creative work environment. We’re always open to new ideas and ways of doing things, while also striving to make things simpler and easier for our customers.
 



  





 At Swedbank Pay, you can develop and expand your competence while working alongside engaging leaders and colleagues. If you’re looking to be challenged in your role and be part of a strong professional community, then this may be the workplace for you.
 



  





**We are looking for a** 
 strategic and operationally strong leader to take on the role of Head of
 *PSP* 
 Online. This position holds overall responsibility for our online products within the Payment Service Provider (PSP) domain, with a clear focus on merchant and customer experience, technology-driven development, and business growth. You will lead a team of approximately 20 people and report directly to the Head of Product & Development. Swedbank Pay has a modern and robust technology platform for providing online payments, but is currently lacking in commercial reach. Within the company`s client portfolio, we have some of the Nordic's most well-known brands. But we have not scaled our online offerings to their full potential yet.
 



  





**More about the position:** 




 As Head of Online within Swedbank Pay Product & Development you will:
 


* Lead, inspire, and develop a cross-functional team consisting of product owners & product managers, developers, architects, and a team leader.
* Define and communicate a clear strategy and vision for PSP Online aligned with the company’s overall goals.
