Enjoy a challenging, international work environment, a central office location with easy access to public transport, and a healthy work-life balance. Submit your application, including your CV, in English via our website. For more information, contact Folmer Koper via folmer1.koper@vattenfall.com. At Vattenfall, we value diversity and welcome all applicants.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Gruppchef Fordon & Styr och övervakning (IT)
description:
*Har du vana att leda digital produktutveckling/leverans av IT-tjänster och förändringsarbete samt tidigare chefserfarenhet? Spana in denna möjlighet som gruppchef till IT-avdelningens nya sektion Teknik och trafiktjänster!*
**Om oss**
 Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.
   

  

 Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. Och vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som gruppchef för Fordon & Styr och övervakning utgör du en del i sektionen Teknik och Trafiktjänsters ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till sektionschefen.  Sektionens ansvar är att Ihop med verksamheten driva IT-utveckling för fordon, anläggning och trafikavtal. Tillsammans omsätter vi idéer i praktiken! Vi utvecklar effektiva och innovativa lösningar som transporterar resenären tryggt och säkert genom anläggningen till tåg, buss och båt – idag, imorgon och i framtiden!
   

  

 Du ansvarar för två områden, fordonsområdet samt styr och övervakning. Det innebär ett ansvar för IT-lösningar som stöttar kollektivtrafik med buss-, båt- och spårburentrafik. Det handlar bland annat om system som möjliggör kommunikation mellan fordon och mark, styrning av trafiksignaler samt IT-stöd för trafikförvaltningens kontroll- och övervakningssystem.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att leda och utveckla en grupp som stödjer verksamhetens behov, med fokus på kvalitet, samverkan och förändringsledning. Du har verksamhets- och personalansvar för en grupp om ca 23 medarbetare samt ansvar för budget och ekonomisk uppföljning och rapportering. Vidare ansvarar du för de produkter och tjänster som gruppen levererar, utvecklar och förvaltar, där du skapa rätt förutsättningar för gruppens dagliga arbete, långsiktiga utveckling och välmående.
   

  

**Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Leda och utveckla teamet genom tydlig kommunikation, delaktighet och trygghet i förändringsprocesser.
* Säkerställa leverans med rätt kvalitet, effektivitet och efterlevnad av riktlinjer, säkerhetskrav och standarder.
* Samverka och delta i forum tvärfunktionellt tillsammans med chefer, avdelningar, verksamhetsägare, operatörer och andra intressenter för att driva organisationens gemensamma utveckling.
* Verksamhetsansvar för gruppens uppdrag med fokus på kvalitet, förbättringar och att möta såväl interna som externa krav.
* Hantera budget, resurser, planering, uppföljning och avtal för kostnadseffektiva leveranser.
* Fullt personalansvar genom arbetsledning, lönesättning, och utvecklingssamtal samt kompetensförsörjning, arbetsmiljö och efterlevnad av lagar, kollektivavtal och policyer.


**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:**
 Du kommer att verka i en komplex organisation med många kontaktytor och arbeta med flera tidshorisonter parallellt. För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som gruppchef för Fordon & Styr och övervakning behöver du kunna kombinera strategisk förståelse med operativ handlingskraft samt ha ett tydligt ledarskap och förmågan att bygga upp starka samarbeten. Vidare är du en kommunikativ och trygg ledare med ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt som gör att du kan leda under förändring och anpassa dig utefter de krav som ställs på verksamheten och gruppen.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Högskole/-universitetsutbildning inom relevant område (systemvetenskap, ekonomi, teknik, ledarskap) eller likvärdig erfarenhet
* Minst 3 års chefserfarenhet med ansvar för ekonomi, personal, planering och uppföljning
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av ledande roll inom digital produktutveckling eller leverans av IT-tjänster
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete och leda i uppbyggnads- eller omställningsfaser
* Vana att arbeta med agila/iterativa arbetssätt och metoder i en kombination med projektleveranser


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Vana att arbeta med komplexa tekniska system med förståelse för arkitekturella principer och teknisk implementation samt att arbeta med outsourcade IT-tjänster, avtal och leverantörskontakter
* Erfarenhet av fordonsrelaterat IT och/eller styr och övervakning (OT)
* Erfarenhet att arbeta inom kollektivtrafik
* Kunskap om IT, informationssäkerhet och GDPR


**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
 På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!
   

  

 Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.
   

  

 Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Malin Lundstedt, tfn 070-7864086. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Petra Magnusson, tfn 08-123 315 92.
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer kan ske löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **26 september** 
 . Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

**Webb och sociala medier**
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida. Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn.
   

  

 Vi är stolta samhällsutvecklare. Med kompetens och engagemang tar vi Stockholm och kollektivtrafiken framåt. Vi ansvarar för SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänsten och Spårvägsmuseet och tillsammans utvecklar vi en trygg, attraktiv och tillgänglig kollektivtrafik för nära 900 000 resenärer. Följ med oss på resan!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/5598 | Kontakt: Petra Magnusson 08-123 31592, Malin Lundstedt 070-7864086, | Facklig företrädare: Camilla Nyberg, Akavia 08-12331847, Marita Lönnroth, Vision 08-12333992, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, Amir Sokolović, Sveriges ingenjörer 08-12333706, | Publicerat: 2025-09-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-09-26

title: Process Manager
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Do you have valuable insights on how to create useful value through efficient process management? Do you want to work with a combination of improving our strategic structures and hands on workflow value? This is a chance to work in a creative environment and be a part of our transformation journey. We are looking for someone skilled in the process craft that wants to step forward and become a member in the group lending process team.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Work in a learning environment together with your highly skilled and experienced colleagues.
* Execute and deliver on given process related assignments from Process Owners and Group Lending Management.
* Participate in the implementation of Enterprise Process Management for group lending.
* Lead and coordinate process changes for new and existing regulatory requirements.
* Lead workshops and coordinate process changes.
* Support Group Lending with a continuous improvement mind-set, providing trainings, tools and support.
* Guide and support Group lending in the complex process landscape. Clarify and simplify processes when needed.
* Build your network and collaborate with colleagues from the business, product development and IT.
* Support implementation of regulations, policies, directives, and instructions.
* Conduct ongoing analysis of processes in line with industry regulations.
* Facilitate mapping, documentation, and maintenance of service blueprints for key processes.
* Work with process improvements based on analysis, audit remarks, incidents and risk reporting.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A genuine interest in working with processes on all process levels, strategic, tactical and operational.
* Experience from process management activities, knowledge in Business Process
* Management methodology, LEAN, SixSigma, Process modelling structures and tools.
* Solid business and academic record.
* Confident in facilitating workshops and coaching change activities.
* Solid experience from handling senior stakeholder expectations.
* Sociable, collaborative and a non-prestigious mindset.
* Delivery focused and a hands-on approach with a strong sense of ownership.
* Strong oral and written communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Proficient skills in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.)
* Experience working with financing and the lending area is merited.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become part of the lending process team. You will have a chance to contribute when we rewrite our process landscape and impact the everyday life of our colleagues and clients. Make a difference and add your experience and perspective to the team."
 **Natalie Arouni,** 
**your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 29.09.2025.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg HQ**
**Recruiting manager: Natalie Arouni**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Produktionsplanerare Täby
description:
**Din nya tjänst** 




 Vår mångåriga kund Teledyne FLIR söker nu dig som vill arbeta med produktionsplanering. På Teledyne FLIR blir du en del av logistikteamet som jobbar med produktionsplanering och inköp av material till deras produktion av högteknologiska värmekameror/system för både land och fordonsinstallationer.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är:** 



* Planera produktion så att Teledyne FLIR uppfyller sina leveransåtaganden gentemot kund.
* Starta och vårda produktionsordrar.
* Delta i morgonmöten med produktion.
* Delta i arbetet med löpande förbättringar av avdelningens verksamhet och arbetsprocesser.
* Ha kontinuerlig kontakt och samarbeta med såväl interna som externa parter, exempelvis andra avdelningar och utvecklingsprojekt på Teledyne FLIR.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har en avslutad eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant inriktning, exempelvis logistik.
* Har några års arbetslivserfarenhet av logistik.
* Har goda kunskaper i Officepaketet, framförallt i Excel.



  





**Det är meriterande om du:** 



* Har tidigare erfarenhet inom SAP.
* Har god teknisk kunskap och intresse.
* Har intresse för hela kedjan i ett tillverkande företag, från offert till leverans.



  





 För denna tjänst behöver du kunna tala och skriva obehindrat på både svenska och engelska. Du som söker tjänsten kommer även att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll innan anställning.
 



  





**Du som person** 




**Du är med fördel:** 



* Öppen
* Samarbetsvillig
* Initiativtagande
* Kommunikativ
* Ansvarstagande
* Lagspelare



  





**Varför jobba på Teledyne FLIR?** 




 Du får möjlighet att utveckla din karriär hos världens ledande företag inom termisk och infraröd teknik. På Teledyne FLIR får du en unik möjlighet att uppleva hur spjutspetsutveckling, mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling samlas under ett tak. Teledyne FLIR gör sin forskning, sin utveckling och sin montering av produkterna i Täby. Vara en del av ett marknadsledande företag med 50 års erfarenhet. Vänlig kultur med fokus på samarbete, problemlösning och kreativitet.
 



  





 På Teledyne FLIR finns ett stort antal aktivitetsgrupper med allt ifrån jogging på lunchen, innebandy, fotoklubb och gemensamma skidresor.
 



  





**Din ansökan** 




 Hjärtligt välkommen med din ansökan till denna spännande tjänst. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Ida Sebitli på 073 856 53 74 eller Sanja Kolar på 070 860 82 52. Intervjuer kommer ske fortlöpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag som är 30/9-25. Vi ser fram emot att få läsa din ansökan!
 



  





**Din nya arbetsgivare** 




 Teledyne FLIR utvecklar, tillverkar och säljer produkter baserade på Infraröd teknik, såsom värmekameror och mätverktyg samt avancerade verktyg för övervakningsteknologi, som fjärrstyrda luft- och markfordon. Med sensorer och andra lösningar bidrar Teledyne FLIR till viktiga säkerhetsuppdrag över hela världen.
 



 Produkterna används bland annat inom försvaret och tillverkande industri och hjälper där räddningspersonal och militär att skydda och rädda liv samt förbättra effektiviteten för olika yrkesgrupper. Med sina produkter vill Teledyne FLIR öka säkerhet och välbefinnande, minska energianvändning och bidra till att skapa smartare och mer hållbara samhällen.
 



  





 Teledyne FLIR strävar efter mångfald och värdesätter de kvaliteter som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.

title: Engineering Director, PKI & IoT
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for an** 
**Engineering Director, PKI & IoT !!**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 41788
   

  

 Step into a high-impact leadership role driving engineering excellence in our PKI/IoT business unit. You’ll guide global teams through influence, not hierarchy—aligning efforts, elevating quality, and delivering secure, scalable products that shape the future of connectivity.
   

  

 This is your chance to lead strategically, inspire technically, and make a global mark.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**Identity and Access Management Solutions (IAMS):**
 HID Global IAM products protect more than 85 million user identities.
   

  

 HID Global Identity and Access Management Solutions products protect more than 85 million user identities. At HID Global, we understand that no person, device, or workplace can go unprotected. This philosophy of Zero Trust drives us to create new advances in risk-based multi-factor authentication, leads us to secure user identities in converged access environments and drives the need to expand implementations with our industry-leading digital certificates and PKIaaS solution to manage them at scale.
   

  

**As our** 
**Engineering Director, PKI & IoT** 
**, you’ll support HID’s success by:**
* Leading the development and execution of the technical roadmap for the business unit, in alignment with product and business goals.
* Providing guidance on technical architecture, system design, and engineering best practices, ensuring the scalability, reliability, and security of solutions.
* Overseeing key technical decisions and ensure that teams are using appropriate tools, frameworks, and methodologies (e.g., Agile, DevOps, CI/CD).
* Staying current with emerging technologies and trends, driving innovation and continuous improvement within the engineering function.
* While engineering team members report to local leaders, the Director of Engineering is responsible for providing functional leadership and mentoring across teams within the business unit.
* Working closely with local leaders to ensure that the engineering talent aligns with the unit’s technical direction and growth objectives.
* Promoting a culture of collaboration, open communication, and shared ownership across distributed teams.
* Acting as a mentor and coach to engineering leads and senior engineers within the function, fostering a supportive and high-performing environment.
* Ensuring consistency in team development, training opportunities, and career progression across locations, in partnership with local leaders.
* Participating in the recruitment of talent, focusing on mid and senior level roles, by providing a second opinion of candidates in the final interview round.
* Partnering with product management and other cross-functional teams to define product requirements, timelines, and deliverables.
* Ensuring timely and efficient delivery of product releases, while managing trade-offs between scope, time, and resources.
* Collaborating with other engineering leaders, especially across shared product efforts, to drive consistency and reduce duplication of effort.
* Ensuring the adoption of agile methodologies, sprint planning, and efficient workflows that enable timely delivery and quick iteration.
* Establishing and continuously improving engineering processes, including code quality standards, testing, release cycles, and incident management.
* Implementing best practices for monitoring and improving performance using agreed frameworks such as DORA and SPACE
* Championing the adoption of automation, DevOps practices, and lean engineering methodologies to optimize workflows and improve productivity.
* Acting as the primary engineering point of contact for business unit leadership, providing regular updates on progress, risks, and roadmaps.
* Building strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including product, marketing, and sales teams, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.
* Working closely with location leaders to address region-specific challenges and opportunities.
* Planning investments in alignment with the directions given by the BA VP of Engineering and Innovation including but limited to site strategy and shared resources/services.
* Planning and managing the engineering budget for the business unit, ensuring efficient use of resources and alignment with business goals.
* Partnering with applicable local leaders on their resource and budget planning to ensure alignment with the Business Unit needs.
* Approving funding of Epics and Features as a Business Owner
* Ensuring that sufficient investments are done in accordance with the agreed capacity allocation guardrails (Features, Enablers, Security and Compliance, Technical Debt and Sustaining/Support)
* Collaborating with HR and recruitment teams, in partnership with local leaders, to attract, hire, and retain top engineering talent across multiple locations.


**Your Experience and Background include:**
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or related practical proven experience.
* 10+ years of experience in software development or engineering leadership roles.
* Deep understanding of software development life cycles, agile methodologies, cloud infrastructure, and system design with 10+ years of experience in these fields.
* Proven experience with large-scale systems, distributed architectures, and complex product portfolios which are consumed externally by customers and partners.
* 10+ years of experience managing and scaling engineering teams, including remote and distributed teams.
* Strong coaching and mentoring skills, with a track record of developing technical talent and fostering inclusive, collaborative team cultures by practicing servant leadership.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in a matrixed organization and managing cross-functional teams.
* Ability to align engineering efforts with business goals and drive product innovation.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience working in global teams across multiple time zones.
* Previous experience within the Identity and Access Management space, preferably focused on PQC, PKI, FIDO, OpenID, credential technologies and Credential Management.
* Strategic thinker with a passion for driving technology innovation.
* Strong advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.
* Results-oriented, with the ability to balance technical depth with business acumen.
* Ability to effectively communicate in the English language, both verbally and in writing.
* Ability to read and interpret technical journals, specifications, international technical standards, etc.


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply.
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers.
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted.


 HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com .
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: HealthTech Co-Founder / Head fo Product (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
 


  


 We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
 


  


 Our offer:
 


  

  
* A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to
 **€500k** 
 in funding.
  
* **1:1 sparring with unicorn founders** 
 on a weekly basis
  
* **Community** 
 : Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
  
* **Team building** 
 : Hiring top notch talent supported through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
  
* **Distribution** 
 : Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine
  
* **Funding support** 
 for securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
  


  


 One of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
 


  

 Tasks
   

  
* You will own, build, and run your startup in fields such as HealthTech
  
* You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
  
* You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
  
* You will receive intensive coaching to make your startup ready to raise millions in funding
  
* You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing engine respectively
  


  

 Requirements
   

  
* You are based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
  
* You are willing to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
  
* You have excellent communication skills in the English language
  


  


 Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

title: Ledare Ansvarsskador – Frekvens & Rättsskydd
description:
**Vill du leda ett skadeteam som gör verklig skillnad för våra kunder?**
 Vi söker en kommunikativ och engagerad ledare med ett genuint intresse för ersättningsrätt och passion för att bygga starka och sammansvetsade team. Rollen som
 *Manager Liability Claims Advisors* 
 innebär en möjlighet att påverka hur vi som försäkringsbolag stöttar våra företagskunder när de ställs inför skadeståndskrav. Ofta handlar det om komplexa och avgörande situationer där vår kompetens verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Välkommen till Nordens ledande sakförsäkringsbolag. Bli en del av vår skadeorganisation och hjälp oss skapa trygghet för våra kunder – varje dag.
   

  

**Om avdelningen**
 Avdelningen för ansvarsskador hanterar nationella ansvarsskador och rättsskydd för våra företags- och industrikunder. I takt med att verksamheten vuxit delar vi nu upp avdelningen i två team:
   

  

* Liability Claims Advisors – med fokus på frekvensskador och snabb ärendehantering
* Liability Claims Experts – med fokus på komplexa och tidskrävande skador


 Samarbetet mellan teamen är nära och avgörande för att skapa en helhet inom avdelningen där både effektivitet och specialistkompetens får ta plats.
   

  

**Om teamet och rollen**
 Nu söker vi en kommunikativ och drivande ledare till
 **Liability Claims Advisors** 
 där du får möjlighet att vidareutveckla ett kompetent team som hanterar vardagsnära ansvarsskador och rättsskydd, där snabba och pragmatiska lösningar är avgörande. Teamet ansvarar även för den initiala fördelningen av inkommande ärenden till avdelningen. Med sju engagerade medarbetare i teamet får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla arbetssätt, stärka teamets samlade kompetens och driva kontinuerliga förbättringar – allt med fokus på kvalitet, kundnytta och utveckling.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ditt team guidar du våra kunder genom skadehändelser på ett tryggt, effektivt och affärsmässigt sätt. Skadeärendena inleds ofta med att kunden mottar ett krav eller en stämningsansökan – och vårt ansvar är att guida dem genom processen, ta reda på vad som har hänt och föra deras talan på ett korrekt och rättvist sätt. Lösningsorientering, god kommunikation och ett starkt rättspatos är centrala delar i arbetet, liksom förmågan att se både kundens och motpartens perspektiv. Här får du leda ett team som varje dag gör skillnad med nyfikenhet, problemlösningsförmåga och ett genuint engagemang. Du arbetar även aktivt med kontinuerliga förbättringar och bidrar till att skapa en effektiv och kundfokuserad skadehantering. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra ledare, affärsområden, jurister och våra nordiska kollegor – i en miljö där utveckling, samverkan och kvalitet står i centrum.
   

  

 Som ledare för teamet får du ett brett och utvecklande uppdrag:
   

  

* Du coachar, inspirerar och vidareutvecklar ditt team, samtidigt som du säkerställer hög kvalitet i den dagliga driften.
* Du driver kontinuerliga förbättringsarbeten inom kundupplevelse, effektivisering, processutveckling och digitalisering.
* Du har ett särskilt fokus på att vidareutveckla hanteringen av frekvensskador – där struktur, snabbhet och pragmatisk problemlösning är avgörande.
* Du analyserar och diskuterar sak- och rättsfrågor tillsammans med skadereglerarna för att hitta rättssäkra och kundfokuserade lösningar.
* Du ingår i den svenska ledningsgruppen för kommersiell skadereglering och samarbetar nära med Underwriting, Sales, Produkt & Pris, Legal och våra nordiska kollegor.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av ledarskap, gärna inom försäkring, juridik eller annan kunskapsintensiv verksamhet.
* God förståelse för ersättningsrätt och ansvarsskador
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och vana att skapa engagemang i team
* Förmåga att bygga team, skapa samarbete och utveckla individer – du är en coachande och närvarande ledare.
* Affärsmässighet och kundfokus, med förmåga att balansera juridiska, ekonomiska och mänskliga perspektiv.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning, gärna kopplat till digitalisering, processutveckling eller effektivisering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Operational Excellence (OPEX) – du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och drivs av att förbättra processer, flöden och resultat.
* Nyfikenhet, problemlösningsförmåga och ett starkt rättspatos.
* God samarbetsförmåga och vana att arbeta tvärfunktionellt.


 Vi ser gärna att du har akademisk utbildning inom juridik eller annan relevant disciplin. Relevant erfarenhet från försäkringsbranschen är meriterande, men inget krav.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna
* Lunchförmån
* Karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter i det största försäkringsbolaget i Norden
* Sociala aktiviteter
* Möjlighet till en hybrid arbetsplats
* En hälsofrämjande arbetsplats som exempelvis erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag
* Rabatt på försäkringar tecknade hos If skadeförsäkringar
* Hög pensionsavsättning


**Mer information om tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen:** 

**Placeringsort:** 
 Bergshamra (Solna)
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 5 oktober 2025. Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande och tillsättning kan ske innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kristin Sandegren, Head of Large Complex & International Claims Sweden Telefon: +46 701 68 32 83
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: EdTech Co-Founder / CEO (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
 


  


 We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
 


  


 Our offer:
 


  

  
* A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to
 **€500k** 
 in funding.
  
* **1:1 sparring with unicorn founders** 
 on a weekly basis
  
* **Community** 
 : Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
  
* **Team building** 
 : Hiring top notch talent supported through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
  
* **Distribution** 
 : Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine
  
* **Funding support** 
 for securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
  


  


 One of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
 


  

 Tasks
   

  
* You will own, build, and run your startup in fields such as EdTech
  
* You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
  
* You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
  
* You will receive intensive coaching to make your startup ready to raise millions in funding
  
* You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing engine respectively
  


  

 Requirements
   

  
* You are based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
  
* You are willing to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
  
* You have excellent communication skills in the English language
  


  


 Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

title: Bachelor Thesis - Trace Documentation Tool
description:
**Grow with us**
**About this opportunity:**
 If you want to join the evolution of Ericsson working with 5G, 6G and be part of one of the most exciting and demanding R&D businesses - this is the job for you. Ericsson is the leader in bringing it to the market. There has never been a better time for you to make your mark. A large group of skilled developers are working energetically to convert 5G and Cloud RAN plans into reality. We are growing and looking for more talent. Are you a master's student excited to apply Gen-AI coding tools to real-world RAN product development. This thesis opportunity invites you to visualize technical debt and to develop using Gen-AI coding tools.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 The aim of this thesis is to evaluate and visualize documentation of code in a web GUI.
   

  

* Contribute to creating a Technical Debt Tool(TDT) to burn off improvement areas. As you will be exposed to high edge integrated RAN products.
* Participate in data visualization, code generating, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Hypothesis would be to create static inline trace wrappers with AI coding assistants’ assistance.
* Learn industry best practices, agile ways of working, and state-of-the-art development environments applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.


**The skills you bring:**
* A bachelor’s degree in computer science, embedded or telecommunications.
* Strong foundation in C and Python programming. Basic knowledge in HTML, CSS.
* Hands on experience with Git, Linux, Gerrit, Doxygen.
* Collaborative and Creative mindset who can easily interact with people.
* Eeagerness to learn, and the courage to take initiative and ownership.
* Strong communication and presentation skills in English.


**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are delighted to announce an exciting opportunity to join Ericsson as a Developer. Within this role, you will have the chance to develop and maintain an array of products and services, spanning across components, units, nodes, networks, systems, and solutions. Your development journey in this role will range from requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, hardware design, software design, integration, simulation, tools design, Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) support, to creating product documentation. The role resonates profoundly with the Ericsson Product Development Principles. Please note that stage 8 and 9 Developer-specific governance and appointment rules are encapsulated within the job role. For further reference, a detailed description of the position outlining domain-specific responsibilities and authorities can be accessed on read more
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Engage in CEE10 Design DGS.
* Undertake the SDI3 Upgrade.
* Proactively share knowledge and collaborate with team members.
* Design solutions using SDI3.
* Incorporate SDI3 into system integration.
* Oversee General Duties within a Cyclic Exec Environment (GDCE).


**The skills you bring:**
* CEE10 Design DGS.
* SDI3 Upgrade.
* Knowledge Sharing and Collaboration Skills.
* SDI3 Solution Design.
* SDI3 Integration.
* GDCE.
* Coaching and Mentoring.
* Innovation and Creativity.
* Google GCP.
* AWS Public Cloud.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 771701

title: Security and Compliance Manager
description:
⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? We offer:**
 Bannerflow is one of Europe’s most exciting SaaS companies. Our Creative Management Platform serves over 6 billion ads monthly on 500 million devices globally, empowering enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house at scale. Our mission is to make digital advertising simple, efficient, and truly creative.
   

  

 We have a culture built on trust, collaboration, and creativity, where teams thrive and grow. In our fun and inclusive workplace, you’ll play a key role in building and scaling our global security and compliance function as we expand into new markets.
   

  

 🦋
 **Are You + Bannerflow = True?**
 We are now hiring a
 **Security & Compliance Manager** 
 to take ownership of our cybersecurity operations. This is a hands-on, operational role reporting directly to the CTO. You will lead, facilitate, and develop Bannerflow’s cyber security efforts across the organisation, including chairing our Risk Committee, coordinating with external security auditors or vCISO partners, and driving internal security and compliance initiatives.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Lead and facilitate our quarterly Cyber Risk Committee meetings
* Own the execution of security initiatives aligned with findings from internal / external audits or due diligence processes
* Act as the operational point of contact for cyber risk and compliance topics
* Drive our risk remediation, documentation, and compliance processes
* Collaborate closely with engineering, IT, and legal to ensure alignment and execution
* Help us evolve our cyber maturity and prepare for eventual certification and audit-readiness


**So, what are we looking for?**
* 3–7 years of experience from similar roles, possibly as a security coordinator, IT compliance lead, or CISO or similar role
* Highly structured and operational, with a bias for action and follow-through
* Experience or strong interest in cyber security, compliance, and governance frameworks (ISO 27001, NIS2, GDPR, etc.)
* A natural communicator, able to work across both technical and business stakeholders
* Fluent in Swedish and English, and eligible to work in Sweden full-time


**Bonus Skills 💡**
 Experience or knowledge in the area of
 **digital advertising compliance** 
 is considered a strong plus, including:
   

  

* Understanding of TCF (Transparency and Consent Framework) and its implementation in digital advertising workflows
* Awareness of privacy and compliance challenges related to AdTech, such as consent management, cookie banners, and lawful data usage
* Knowledge of relevant regulations and standards such as GDPR, ePrivacy, and how these apply specifically to media buying, audience targeting, and tracking technologies
* Familiarity with audit and control frameworks related to ad platform integrations and data sharing with third parties


 These competencies will help you collaborate closely with our product, tech, and legal teams to ensure that
 **security and compliance are embedded in how we build and run our advertising platform.**
**Why join us? 🤔**
 At Bannerflow, we value Passion, Collaboration, and Challenge. You’ll play a key role in ensuring our security and compliance practices enable fast, safe growth while supporting teams across tech, product, and business functions. We offer a competitive package with pension, health benefits, parental leave top-up, and more—plus a fun workplace with hackathons, padel, and Friday beers. We welcome diverse backgrounds and experiences, and believe inclusion makes us stronger.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about security, risk management, and ensuring compliance across a growing organisation, we want you in our team!

title: Informationsarkitekt
description:
**Till vår kund söker vi nu en Informationsarkitekt.** 




  





**Uppdragsbeskrivning:** 




 Ansvarar för att kartlägga, utveckla och förvalta informationsarkitekturen inom ett eller flera verksamhetsområden eller informationsdomäner, där många system och skiftande datamängder ingår. Utarbetar informations- och begreppsmodeller och bidrar till att definiera och vidareutveckla ramverk, metodik och riktlinjer för informationsarkitektur. Arbetet inkluderar informationsarkitektur för känslig och säkerhetsklassad information. Vi behöver även betänka relevant lagstiftning så som offentlighetsprincipen, offentlighets- och sekretesslagen (OSL) och GDPR. Rollen innebär självständigt arbete och att koordinera nödvändiga personer över hela verksamheten mot gemensamma mål t ex genom workshops och begreppsseminarier.
 



  





**I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Facilitering och begreppsanalys
* Modellera, analysera och dokumentera av begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller i EA-verktyg
* Definiera dataset, nycklar och metadata
* Datamodellering ”reverse engineering” via IT-systemens GUI
* Kartlägga och analysera informationsflöden och masterdataprocesser
* Dimensionell modellering
* Planera och arrangera workshops
* Delta och stödja i arbete med arkitekturstyrning och metodutveckling



  





**Obligatoriska krav:** 



* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba med informationsarkitektur, i enlighet med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att modellera begrepp, information och data utifrån standardiserade modelleringsspråk under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arkitekturarbete inom en samhällskritisk verksamhet alternativt verksamhet med mycket höga säkerhetskrav under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba med medelstora till stora organisationer (>500 anställda) med många system och skiftande datamängder under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta självständigt och arbetsleda en mindre grupp under de senaste 5 åren.



  





**Mervärdeskrav:** 



* Certifierad informationsarkitekt, verksamhetsarkitekt eller IT-arkitekt.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom en myndighet, kommun eller region med praktisk tillämpning av relevanta lagar, t.ex. GDPR och OSL, i minst 3 år under de senaste 5 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av minst ett uppdrag i elbranschen under de senaste 3 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta i modelleringsverktyg, t.ex. Sparx, i minst 3 år under de senaste 5 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av workshopledning och/eller begreppsseminarier kopplat till informationsarkitektur i minst 2 år under de senaste 5 åren.



  





**Nedanstående personliga egenskaper säkerställs vid intervju, samt eventuellt via referenser:** 



* God samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta i team
* Trygg i att leda och koordinera arbetsinsatser i mindre gruppe
* Strukturerad, analytisk och noggrann med sinne för detalje
* Ödmjuk och förtroendeingivande
* Målinriktad, lösningsorienterad och ansvarstagande
* Fallenhet för administrativa arbetsuppgifter och dokumentation



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler.
 



**Start:** 
 Preliminärt 2025-11-17
 



  





**Information:** 



* **Resor kan förekomma (in- och/eller utrikes).**
* ***Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.***
* ***Ansök senast* 
 2025-09-18**
* ***Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.***



  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Manager - Design Systems
description:
Spotify’s centralized Design System is essential for every user experience we create. Spanning our Consumer products, Business-to-Business (B2B) offerings, and Internal Tools, our system enables cohesive, accessible, and scalable design components across all touchpoints. As we enter a new era powered by AI, we’re looking for a visionary Senior Manager to lead our team and drive our design system to the next level.
   

  

 As Senior Manager you will own the vision, strategy, and execution of Spotify’s centralized design system. You’ll lead a talented multidisciplinary team, bridging design, engineering, and AI to ensure our system empowers all product and design teams with best-in-class tools, patterns, and practices. You’ll play a key role in evolving our design system to unlock the full potential of AI, driving innovation, efficiency, and design coherence at scale. Your background could be in Design, Product or Engineering.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Lead the Centralized Design System: Set the strategic direction, roadmap, and priorities for Spotify’s design system, ensuring it meets the needs of consumer products, B2B platforms, and internal tools.
* Drive AI Innovation: Champion the integration of AI-driven capabilities—such as generative design, automation, and intelligent components—to advance how teams use and contribute to the system.
* Team Management: Grow, mentor, and inspire a diverse team of designers, engineers, and design ops specialists, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
* Cross-Company Collaboration: Build strong relationships with product, engineering, and business partners to ensure system adoption, alignment, and impact across all verticals.
* Governance and Quality: Oversee robust governance, documentation, and contribution models to maintain quality, accessibility, and scalability.
* Measure and Improve: Define targets and success metrics, gather feedback across R&D, and continually iterate to improve the system’s effectiveness and reach.
* Evangelize and Educate: Advocate for the value and impact of the design system, hosting internal workshops, presentations, and documentation to drive awareness and engagement.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have significant experience managing and scaling design systems, ideally in a centralized capacity for large-scale consumer and/or enterprise products.
* You have deep expertise in design principles, UX/UI standards, accessibility, and design operations.
* You have demonstrated experience integrating AI, automation, or machine learning into design systems or workflows.
* You possess strong leadership skills with experience building and mentoring high-performing, cross-functional teams.
* You have a proven ability to influence and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders, from designers and engineers to product and business leads.
* You are proficient with modern design, prototyping, and documentation tools, and a familiarity with front-end frameworks.
* You are passionate about fostering an inclusive and innovative design culture.
* You have a solid understanding of Design Excellence


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Stockroom Assistant (Part Time - 16 Hours) - Barkaby B-Pool
description:
HUGO BOSS is one of the leading fashion and lifestyle companies in the premium segment with over 19,000 employees worldwide. As versatile as we are, we are united by a common goal: We love fashion, we change fashion!
   

  

 Become a brand ambassador and be part of a team that works with passion, ambition and expertise to create excellent customer experiences. Be among the first to bring our collections from the runway to the customers! Join our team and explore career opportunities that are tailor-made for you!
   

  

 In your role as a Stockroom Associate, you are responsible for all stockroom operations to optimize the retail business and enhance efficiency of the selling process to drive commercial success.
   

  

 We are looking for passionate candidates to join our innovative and inspiring team at Hugo Boss. We celebrate success, work collaboratively and make the impossible possible. If you thrive in a fun yet entrepreneurial environment and have a drive to succeed - this could be the role for you.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
* Responsible for physical stock management and movement as well as maintaining the effective overall stock flow and storage process to improve and speed up the customer experience
* Ensure the highest standard of housekeeping is observed in all back of house areas at all times.
* Supporting in all operations for loss prevention
* Proficient utilization of business systems & latest technology
* Drive the use of all available tools and ensure procedures are executed and policies followed
* Accurately complete all Stock handling paperwork to a World Class standard.
* Ensure all delivery and transfer requests are processed quickly and to Company Policy.
* Support Management team by ensuring the shop floor is replenished, by size.
* Support store team by implementing floor moves, when required.
* Understand and execute all systems and stock procedures to ensure quick and accurate deliveries and transfers at all times.
* Support the Management team by successfully running stock reports, when necessary and communicate these to the rest of the team.
* Support the Management team with stock count and bi-annual stock takes


**Your Profile**
* Previous experience in stockroom controlling
* Proficient utilization of business systems & latest technology
* Demonstrate strong commercial acumen
* Willingness to constantly learn & develop
* Passionate & knowledgeable about the brand
* Excellent communication skills at all levels, both written and verbal
* Experience in networking & building relationships


**Your Benefits**
* Competitive salary, commission and attractive benefits
* Global career path for specialists and leadership
* Tailored trainings and development opportunities
* International and inspirational working environment with a dynamic work culture


 We are a global company with our employees representative of the world at large. Our inclusive culture embraces each person's authenticity and individuality. We are committed to equal employment opportunity. And we believe our equitable work environment helps unleash your full potential and inspires you to thrive.
   

  

 Do you feel it's time for a new challenge at HUGO BOSS? If so, we look forward telling you all about this job opportunity in a personal conversation.

title: Team Manager Partnerships
description:
**We value your personality and passion! Join a hyper-growth scale-up where you’ll be able to work on a huge variety of projects and benefit from rapid development opportunities. 🎉** 




  





**Let's build the future together!** 





 Teamtailor
 
 is a global Employer Branding and ATS SaaS platform used by over 12,000+ companies and is available in 90 countries worldwide. 🌍
 



  





 Working at
 
 Teamtailor
 
 means being part of a dynamic, fast-paced tech company that values impact and responsibility. Our workplace fosters an environment where everyone can contribute meaningfully to the growth of the company. 🎉🥳
 



  





 Building a diverse team with a wide range of experiences, skills, and backgrounds has always been central to Teamtailor’s mission, and it remains a strength today. We welcome all individuals who share our vision and are committed to contributing to our collective success. Join us in helping companies and people communicate in more meaningful ways to make life-changing decisions together.👫
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As a Team Manager in Partnerships at Teamtailor, you’ll lead a Team of regional Partnerships Managers. We are a team of 15 Partnerships Managers worldwide and we are looking for a Team Manager to Manage a team of 5-6 PM´s, overseeing 2-3 regions.
 



  





 As a Team Manager you are accountable for team performance and will be focused on driving growth, supporting development, and operationalizing excellence. You will be heavily focused on coaching, market strategy, decision-making, and owning team-level outcomes. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about about building high performing teams, thrives on structure and accountability, and enjoys being in the driver's seat when it comes to setting the pace and culture of a team. You’ll also support the strategic development of the Partnerships function in collaboration with the Head of Partnerships.
 



  





**Key responsibilities in the role:** 




 📊
 **Performance Management:** 



* Accountable for team quota achievement and regional performance metrics.
* Develop and execute and support strategic projects to maximize revenue and profitability coming from partnerships in your designated regions.
* Coach and ensure team is progressing towards local targets and KPI´s.
* Own or partially one or a few highly strategic partnerships within regional responsibility.



  





**🤝 Team coaching and development:** 



* Recruit, train, and onboard new Partnership Managers.
* Provide coaching, mentoring, and ongoing performance feedback.
* Foster a positive and motivated culture within the team.



  





**🙏🏽 Partnerships Strategy and Planning:** 



* Collaborate with Head of Partnerships to develop and execute partnership strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Analyze market trends, partner needs and opportunities, as well as competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities.
* Develop and implement partnership initiatives to further revenue growth in your designated regions.



  





**🌎 Reporting and Analysis:** 



* Generate reports and performance metrics to assess team performance.
* Analyze partnership data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.
* Use data-driven insights to make informed decisions and adjust strategies as needed.
* Report performance metrics and learnings from your team towards management.



  





**Qualifications** 




 For us, personality and passion come before education. Your difference is your strength and you will always be supported and looked after by your Teamtailor family. You will have the responsibility for your own work, meaning that working with a globally spread team isn’t something you mind.
 



  





**We believe you have:** 



* 5+ years experience in partnerships, with at least 2 years in leadership capacity
* Proven track record of consistent performance and team influence
* Comfortable managing quota-carrying roles and supporting variable compensation
* Strong process thinker with ability to drive clarity and alignment
* Emotionally mature, structured, and accountable leader
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Experience in HR tech or a SaaS scale-up is considered a strong advantage
* **This role will require complete fluency in English, any other fluent languages are considered an advantage.**
* **In the cities where we have a local office we have an office first policy and would like to see a min of 3/days per week in the office.**



  





**As a Team Manager in Partnerships at Teamtailor you will be offered :** 



* ✨ the opportunity to sell the market's leading employer branding and recruitment platform
* 💰 a fixed salary and a generous commission model with no caps that reward people who are motivated and perform well
* 🏃🏻 ♂️ development opportunities in a fast-growing environment, continuous training, and support
* 🏝 paid holidays and the chance to attend our yearly 3-day company trip to a secret summer destination all cover by us
* 🍾 tons of team events, celebrations, weekly competitions and rewards
* 🎁 A number of benefits local to the country you are based in (ask us during the interview process!)
* 💕 and most importantly, you would get to work with the most fantastic coworkers !



  





 If this sounds like you, then you know what to do 😉
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application.
 **Good luck from your future colleagues 🍀**

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

title: Senior Artist
description:
**Fantasma Games is now part of EveryMatrix.** 




**You can apply here:** 




 https://everymatrix.teamtailor.com/jobs/6405630-senior-artist
 



  





 EveryMatrix is a leading B2B SaaS provider delivering iGaming software, content and services. We provide casino, sports betting, platform and payments, and affiliate management to 300 customers worldwide.
 



**But that's not all! We're not just about numbers,** 
 we're about people. With a team of over 1400 passionate individuals spread across twelve countries in Europe, Asia, and the US, we're all united by our love for innovation and teamwork.
 



 Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to redefine the iGaming landscape, one groundbreaking solution at a time.
 



 About the job: 
 



**Join our Stockholm Game Studio and be at the forefront of creating visually stunning slot games that captivate players worldwide. As a Senior Artist, you'll have the opportunity to blend traditional artistic excellence with modern tools and technologies, including AI when beneficial, leading the way in innovative game art creation. This role offers the perfect balance of creative freedom, technical challenge, and leadership opportunity in a rapidly evolving industry. Our recent games\*—such as Gold Pigger, Vulcan’s Gold, and Shadow Summoner Egypt—have been topping the charts, and we are at the beginning of an exciting journey to become a major studio in the iGaming industry.** 




  





**What You'll get to do:** 
  
 



  




* Create high-quality art assets that set our visual standards
* Design and develop compelling symbols, backgrounds, and UI elements
* Maintain efficient productivity while meeting deadlines and quality benchmarks
* Review and provide feedback on art assets
* Identify opportunities where AI and other modern tools can enhance productivity without compromising quality
* Thoughtfully integrate AI art generation tools when they provide clear benefits to the workflow



  





 Technical Understanding and Optimization
 


* Create assets that meet technical specifications and performance requirements
* Collaborate with technical artists to ensure efficient asset implementation



  





 Leadership and Mentorship 
 


* Provide art direction and mentorship to junior artists
* Review and critique team members' work constructively
* Share knowledge and best practices with the art team



  





 Project Management and Communication 
 


* Manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Contribute to project planning and resource allocation discussions



  





 Continuous Learning and Growth 
 


* Stay current with industry trends in game art and slot game design
* Research and share new artistic techniques and tools
* Attend relevant workshops and training sessions



  





**What You need to stand out:** 
  
 



 Proficiency with Spine 
 



 Ability to work in various art styles 
 



 Excellent communication, patience, open-mindedness, and a willingness to learn 
 



 Good English skills 
 



 Understanding of slots and the gambling business is a big plus
 



  





 Here's What We Offer: 
 


* Pension Plan: Standard employer contribution of 4.5%, providing a secure foundation for your future financial well-being.
* Long-Term Disability and Injury Insurance: Coverage through Euro Accident, ensuring financial support in case of unexpected events.
* Comprehensive Health Insurance: Access to high-quality healthcare services, tailored to meet your needs.
* Health Care Allowance (friskvårdsbidrag): Additional financial support for personal health-related expenses.
* Hybrid work schedule: Minimum 60% work from the office and up to 40% work from home on a quarterly basis. During your first 3 months of employment, you will work 100% from the office.
* Online learning platform: Access to leading online learning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning and Udemy for Business.



  





**Benefits and Perks:** 



* Monthly lunch allowance.
* Gym Membership.
* Our office perks include frequent team-building activities in various locations.



  




* **At EveryMatrix, we're committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where you can thrive both personally and professionally. Come join us and experience the difference! EveryMatrix is a member of the World Lottery Association (WLA) and European Lotteries Association. In September 2023 it became the first iGaming supplier to receive WLA Safer Gambling Certification. EveryMatrix is proud of its commitment to safer gambling and player protection whilst producing market leading gaming solutions.**

title: People & Culture Generalist
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **People & Culture Generalist** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 . This is a one-year parental leave cover position, starting at the end of 2025. We have an office first approach meaning that most of the work will take place at our office in Stockholm. Are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We are looking for someone who will contribute to the positive and inspiring atmosphere in our team. You thrive in a collaborative environment, enjoy coaching and supporting managers, and are ready to roll up your sleeves when needed. We believe that you have a genuine interest in people and culture and are a true team player.
   

  

 You are independent and communicative, which means that you can identify what needs to be done and take initiatives to solve different situations.
   

  

* Advise and support managers on a wide range of employee relations and personnel matters.
* Participate in the implementation and execution of the Viaplay Group yearly people processes in your function/markets, led by the Head of People & Culture.
* Proactively coach and support managers in your assigned functions on the entire employee lifecycle; people matters, labour law, etc.
* Drive employee engagement initiatives and support employee well-being.
* Ensure that we are compliant in labour law and work environment and participate in keeping policies up to date and ensure that we handle employee data in accordance with local legislation
* Perform administrative tasks and provide support in employee-related matters through our service desk.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have experience in the following:
   

  

* University degree within a relevant area.
* 2-3+ years of experience working in a P&C generalist role or equivalent with proven HR knowledge, such as people matters, rehabilitation, and the P&C yearly processes.
* Solid understanding of labor laws, compliance requirements and experience of working with union negotiations.
* Strong communication skills and ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.
* Excellent ability to communicate in Swedish and English.


 What we offer you
   

  

**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Developer & Module Specialist - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en certifierad SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist till vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist kommer du att inneha en expertroll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att förvalta, integrera och implementera funktionalitet i SuccessFactors olika moduler. Genom ditt arbete kommer du att säkerställa en smidig, stabil och snabb implementering av ny programvara och uppdateringar i installerade applikationer. Du kommer att tillsammans med övriga teamet medverka i frågor rörande aktuella och framtida vägval för plattformens tekniska utveckling.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
