title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 CGI's Development CoE söker fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Hos oss är det lätt att trivas – vi stöttar varandra, delar kunskap och ser till att ha kul längs vägen. Hos oss är det lätt att vara sig själv, och det finns alltid någon att bolla idéer eller utmaningar med.
   

  

 Vår vardag består av spännande projekt där vi tillsammans hittar smarta lösningar för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett team med bred kompetens och stort hjärta, där samarbete både internt och med våra kunder står i fokus.
   

  

 Och ja, vi gillar att göra saker tillsammans även utanför jobbet – som en spelkväll eller AW då och då – helt frivilligt så klart! Om du vill arbeta i ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom IT i Sverige, men samtidigt få känslan av en tight och trygg arbetsgrupp – då tror vi att du kommer trivas riktigt bra hos oss.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Designa, implementera och hantera Azure iPaaS-lösningar, inklusive infrastrukturprovisionering med ARM/Bicep.
* Utveckla och underhålla infrastrukturautomationsskript med Python eller PowerShell.
* Konfigurera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines med Azure DevOps för effektiv bygg- och releasehantering.
* Hantera versionshanteringssystem, upprätthålla Git-arbetsflöden och stödja strategier för grening och sammanslagning.
* Ansvara för hela infrastrukturen under dess livscykel – från miljöuppsättning till övervakning, underhåll och felsökning.
* Stödja byggprocesser, pakethantering och distribution av applikationer i både produktions- och testmiljöer.
* Integrera och underhålla verktyg för kodkvalitet och artefakthantering såsom SonarQube och Artifactory; stödja observabilitet via Elastic Stack eller Splunk.
* Integrera säkerhetskontroller och rutiner i CI/CD-arbetsflöden, med efterlevnad av organisatoriska och regulatoriska standarder.
* Integrera och underhålla verktyg för statisk och dynamisk kodanalys inom utvecklingslivscykeln.
* Implementera härdning av infrastruktur, efterlevnad av konfigurationspolicyer och automatiserat säkerhetsregelverk med exempelvis Azure Policy.
* Samarbeta med säkerhetsteam för att stödja incidentdetektion, analys och respons i molnbaserade plattformar.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av DevOps-, SecOps- eller molninfrastruktur.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och vana att tolka och implementera komplexa krav.
* Djup kompetens inom Azure iPaaS, Resource Manager och distribution via ARM/Bicep-mallar.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att skriva skript i Python eller PowerShell.
* God kunskap om Azure DevOps pipelines, bygg-/releaseprocesser och applikationsdistribution i olika miljöer.
* Gedigen förståelse för Git, branching strategier och best practices inom versionshantering.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera hela infrastrukturen under dess livscykel, inklusive underhåll, övervakning och felsökning.
* Kännedom om byggverktyg, pakethantering och applikationsserverinfrastruktur.
* Arbetskunskap om databaser, nätverk och integrationsplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av SonarQube, Artifactory och gärna Elastic Stack eller Splunk.
* Förmåga att leda estimeringar, teknisk design, utveckling och distributioner.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera säkerhetsrutiner i CI/CD-pipelines.
* Kännedom om statisk och dynamisk kodanalys för säker kodvalidering.
* Förståelse för infrastrukturhärdning och automatisering av efterlevnad.
* Erfarenhet av att integrera säkerhetsskanningsverktyg (t.ex. sårbarhetsskanning av beroenden).


 Meriterande om du också har:
   

  

* Certifiering: Microsoft Certified – Azure Administrator Associate
* Erfarenhet av hotmodellering och riskbedömningar.
* Kännedom om SIEM-verktyg och plattformar för sårbarhetshantering.


 Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:
   

  

 Integrationsteamet på CGI är ett gäng som trivs ihop, delar kunskap och stöttar varandra. Här är det lätt att vara sig själv, och det finns alltid någon att bolla idéer med. Ibland gör vi något kul tillsammans efter jobbet, som en spelkväll – bara om man vill, såklart!
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna rekryterande konsultchef Ramya Parthasarathy, ramya.parthasarathy@cgi.com eller konsultchef Henrik Sjöstedt, henrik,sjostedt@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: AI Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**AI Engineer – Driv realiseringen av AI:s potential tillsammans med Sopra Steria!**
 Vill du vara med och skapa verkligt värde med hjälp av generativ AI? Hos oss på Sopra Steria får du arbeta nära både kunder och kollegor i uppdrag där de senaste teknikerna används för att identifiera, bygga och implementera lösningar som gör skillnad på riktigt.
   

  

 Vi ligger i framkant inom generativ AI och bygger allt från smarta assistenter och prediktiva analyser till automatiserade och integrerade lösningar baserade på Agentic Process Automation. Nu söker vi dig som vill bidra med din erfarenhet, nyfikenhet och expertis i tvärfunktionella team – och samtidigt fortsätta utvecklas i takt med tekniken.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som AI Engineer blir du en del av vårt AI & Analytics-team och får möjlighet att arbeta i uppdrag med hög innovationshöjd. I rollen kommer du exempelvis att:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar på moderna molnplattformar, såsom Microsoft Azure AI Foundry
* Arbeta med tekniker som Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) och utveckla domänanpassade AI-agenter
* Ha nära kontakt med kundens verksamhet för att säkerställa att de lösningar vi bygger skapar värde på riktigt


**Vem vi söker**
 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datahantering, analys eller avancerad analys, och att du tagit klivet mot en mer specialiserad AI-profil. Du brinner för att skapa värde genom datadrivna insikter och vill ligga i framkant när det gäller generativ AI.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar, t.ex. LLM och RAG, på plattformar som Microsoft Azure AI Foundry eller motsvarande
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av Python eller andra relevanta programmeringsspråk
* Intresse för systemutveckling och förmåga att arbeta nära verksamheten


 Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Avancerad analys och Data Science, t.ex. statistisk modellering och maskininlärning
* Klassisk Business Intelligence, från datahantering i Data Warehouse och relationella databaser till datamodellering och visualiseringar i t.ex. Power BI


*Är du riktigt senior och funderar på om det inte är dig vi söker? Tvivla inte, med många uppdrag i framkant finns utmaningar för alla.*
**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Spännande uppdrag där du är med och utvecklar lösningar baserade på den senaste AI-tekniken
* Möjlighet att bidra i hela kedjan – från idé till leverans – och påverka både kundens och Sopra Sterias vision
* En arbetsmiljö där du får växa, med stöd av kompetenta och erfarna kollegor
* Flexibilitet att arbeta både på plats och remote beroende på uppdrag


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet- och logiktest, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Victoria på v.stjernstroem@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
description:
**Skills**
 As a
 **Machine Learning Engineer Intern** 
 , you will play a key role in designing and building machine learning models for our edge ML product. You will tackle challenges that let you apply your skills across software engineering, data science, computer vision and machine learning. By joining our team, you’ll help enhance the reliability and safety of our vehicles, directly contributing to their performance on the road. This is an opportunity to join the team during 6 months in a part-time internship. To put it into specifics you will:
   

  

* Build a cutting-edge machine learning product and see your model deployed on Voi vehicles worldwide.
* Build a machine learning product end-to-end, from dataset creation, PoC model development, edge ML optimisation, to model deployment and business impact measurement.
* Support production-grade models with a focus on reliability and scalability, and high performance.
* Collaborate with a world-class, cross-functional product team, learning from and supporting each other while aligning on priorities and business outcomes.


**What You Need To Embark**
 We are looking for an ambitious and curious student looking to build a career in Machine Learning. In addition to being collaborative and fluent in English we believe the right person has:
   

  

* 1 year or less remaining on a Masters degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Robotics, or related field
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience using Git
* Knowledge in common machine learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks, transfer learning, object detection, has been applying models in frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn
* Experience with edge computing or embedded coding is a plus.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 150,000+ vehicles in 110+ towns and cities across 13 countries, serving 8+ million riders with over 375+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Senior Test Engineer Cloud (all genders)
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Tester (all genders) to join our growing Cloud Engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality of our cloud-based applications and infrastructure, with a key emphasis on test planning, execution, and automation. You will work closely with developers, cloud engineers, designers, Product Owners and Product Managers to define testing strategies, create comprehensive test plans, and build robust automated test suites.
   

  

 Since our cloud area is still in an early phase of test automation, this role offers a unique opportunity to lead the selection and establishment of test frameworks from the ground up. You will have the freedom to shape our testing approach and set best practices, becoming a key driver in building a solid foundation for quality assurance in our cloud solutions.
   

  

 You will be an advocate for quality, diligently identifying and mitigating risks throughout the development lifecycle.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and implement testing strategies for various testing types (e.g., functional, integration, performance, security, regression)
* Design, develop, implement and maintain automated test scripts using industry-standard tools and frameworks.
* Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases based on requirements and design specifications.
* Execute test cases and document results accurately.
* Build and expand our automated test suite to cover critical functionality.
* Work closely with developers and cloud engineers to ensure quality throughout the development lifecycle.
* Analyze test results and provide clear and concise reports to stakeholders.
* Integrate automated tests into our CI/CD pipeline.


**Requirements**
* 7+ years of experience in software testing
* Proficient understanding of software testing methodologies and best practices.
* Experience with test planning, test case design, and test execution.
* Proficiency in at least one test automation framework (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright).
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing integration.
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and concepts (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP). Practical experience working in Linux environments.
* Knowledge of cloud-related technologies such as gateways, MQTT, and Protobuf.
* Proficient communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills in English.


**Soft Skills**
* Proficient collaboration skills, working with developers, engineers, and product roles in agile teams.
* Handle a constantly changing setting with evolving challenges and new developments.
* Capable of functioning effectively in an evolving environment where automated testing structures and procedures are in the process of development.
* Experienced in taking initiative and contributing to the establishment and improvement of test automation frameworks from the ground up.
* Flexible and solution-oriented, with a keen commitment to contribute to the improvement and streamlining of testing processes within a growing organization.
* Thrive in sharing knowledge and learning with other team members, and to take on mentoring role to support junior testers.
* An engaged mindset with a commitment to enhancing quality across the entire development lifecycle.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
```html
 



**About the Company** 




  





  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable, and automated infrastructure solutions? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where innovation and collaboration are key? We're looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our Platform Delivery and Reliability Services (PDRS) team and help us take our Observability Platform to the next level. At FDJ UNITED, we believe in an automation-first approach to designing infrastructure services that empower our brands worldwide. If you're eager to drive excellence, proactively prevent issues, and bridge the gap between Development and Infrastructure, we want to hear from you! By joining us, you'll become part of a forward-thinking team where your expertise drives innovation and your ideas make a real impact. We work agile, with a strong focus on quality, collaboration, and personal growth. If you're ready to elevate your career and help shape the future of our platform services, this is the role for you.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Design, build, and integrate cutting-edge Monitoring and Observability solutions with an automation-driven mindset.
* Proactively prevent and troubleshoot production issues to keep our systems stable and performant.
* Boost reliability across products and services by implementing best practices and innovative tools.
* Work closely with Development and Infrastructure teams to seamlessly weave observability requirements—metrics, traces, logs, alerts—into new systems' designs.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





  





 Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer with hands-on skills in logging platforms such as Splunk, ElasticSearch, Graylog, FluentD, or Vector.
 



  





  





**Required Skills** 




  





  




* Strong coding skills in scripting languages like Bash, Python, or Golang, including code review experience.
* Deep expertise in Linux OS and distributed systems.
* Solid background with Time Series Databases and visualization (especially Grafana).
* Experience with alerting and monitoring tools like Prometheus, Icinga, Datadog, or Nagios.
* Familiarity with CD/CI tools (Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub Actions) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation).
* Knowledge of container orchestration platforms (Kubernetes, Nomad, OpenShift) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, OpenStack) is a plus.
* Interest or experience in AI and AI tools is considered an advantage.



  





  





**Preferred Skills** 




  





  





 This role is based on a hybrid working model. We require employees to be onsite in the office at least two days per week, with flexibility to work remotely on the remaining days.
 



  





  





**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





  





 Our world is hybrid. A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





  





 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
 



  





 ```

title: ServiceNow Consultant/ Developer for a leading IT Company in Stockholm
description:
*\*Please note than only Swedish Speaking candidates will be considered for the further interview process.* 




  




* **Salary range is 55,000 - 65,000 SEK per month.**



  





 This reputable IT company is dedicated to modernizing the IT landscape for their clients, driving efficiency, agility, and innovation to achieve their digital ambitions. Serving large organizations across various industries and the public sector, they focus on ServiceNow as a leading IT Service Management platform within the market. Currently, they are seeking a skilled ServiceNow Developer to lead innovation and excellence within their team of developers.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Implement ServiceNow modules ITSM and HR for our customers.
* Able to implement integration using REST API or any other standard integration platforms available.
* Contribute as ServiceNow developer in projects ranging from simple to complex.
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow.
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow.
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Certified ServiceNow Administrator and preferably Certified Implementation Specialist in ITSM and CSM
* Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in ServiceNow developer working for clients
* Strong technical knowledge about on-premise ServiceNow ITSM and CSM module
* Candidates with strong experience in implementing ServiceNow native automation capabilities are preferred.
* Proven track record working in ServiceNow platform as technical consultant. Analyses and improves current implementation and solutions.
* Is able to explain and present new ideas and solutions.



  





**As a person you are:** 



* Demonstrated ability to communicate well with customers and within organization
* Well-spoken, articulate and communicative
* Self-managed and well organized
* Natural ability to work in global environment and people



  





**Benefits:** 



* Growth-oriented work environment with mentorship and professional development opportunities
* Comprehensive health benefits including sports compensation, dental and vision coverage, healthy office snacks, sick leave compensation from the first day of absence, and company-covered doctor visits
* Onsite work model with flexible working hours



  





**IT Jobs Worldwide** 




 IT Jobs Worldwide is a professional recruitment company that focuses on connecting IT talents with the most exciting vacancies worldwide. We specialize in specific IT areas including Java, PHP, .NET, Python, JavaScript, Swift, Objective-C, Kotlin, Dart, QA and Testing, Data and BI, and Infrastructure.
 



 IT Jobs Worldwide is part of the Worldwiders brands, with more than 60 colleagues all over Europe. We have offices in Oslo, Tallinn, Malaga, Malta, and Lisbon. With over 300 clients in over 30 countries, our recruitment solutions are tailormade and set up to add value that benefits the matchmaking process.

title: Junior iOS Engineer
description:
**Description**
**ABOUT US**
 Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm, that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.
   

  

 Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.
   

  

 We work with over 70,000 leaders and 3,000 organisations across the world, with clients across the Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and OMX 30. In 2024 we received substantial backing from K1 Investment Management – the leading B2B Enterprise SaaS investors. We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we are looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.
   

  

 As we grow, we are fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.
   

  

 With three international locations (UK, Sweden, Mauritius) and over 15 nationalities represented, the team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you will find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, and philanthropic activities.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.
   

  

**Our Engineering Team**
 We build, maintain, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Board Intelligence, we're looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Junior iOS Engineer to join our expanding team. In this role, you'll be involved in the development and maintenance of our iOS applications using Swift (and potentially some Objective-C). Reporting to a Senior Engineer, you'll work with different teams, including Product, Design, and QA, to help build and deliver new features that support our company's aims.
   

  

**What Excites You**
* Write and maintain good quality code in Objective C and/or Swift
* Work with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and contribute to building new features for our product and users
* Participate in technical discussions and learn about the architecture of our mobile applications
* Take responsibility for specific tasks or smaller features, ensuring they meet our quality standards
* Learn from and be supported by senior engineers within the team
* Help to identify and fix bugs based on user feedback and testing
* Be encouraged to stay up-to-date with new technologies and best practices in the industry


**Requirements**
**What Excites Us**
 We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.
   

  

 We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:
   

  

  

* Experience with Swift and the iOS environment
* An understanding of the app development process would be a bonus
* A basic understanding of different ways to structure iOS apps (like MVVM or MVC) and a willingness to learn more about building scalable and maintainable applications
* A desire to contribute to good user experiences and the ability to work both independently on tasks and collaboratively within a team to solve problems
* A willingness to learn from and be supported by more senior developers and share knowledge as you grow
* An interest in maintaining good code quality and performance, and an openness to learning about tools like testing and code reviews


**Our iOS Tech Stack**
* Swift & Objective-C for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS Catalyst applications
* MVVM architecture with functional reactive programming patterns
* Realm database with encryption for local storage
* Cocoapods and Swift Package Manager for dependency management
* GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Testflight, Fastlane for CI/CD and collaboration


**Benefits**
 We pride ourselves on our great working environment and package. Here’s some of what’s on offer:
   

  

  

* 25 days of Vacation with Advanced Vacation days
* Wellness benefits including a wellness hour per week for exercise and up to SEK 2,000 per year for wellness activities
* Parental leave with 90% salary coverage for up to 6 months
* Comprehensive insurance including Group Life, TFA Safety and Travel
* Regular team lunches and fikas
* ITP1 + Flexpension
* Vision benefit with free eye test & terminal glasses
* Tax-free daily allowances for travel
* Activities such as conferences, kick-offs, and other events

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a skilled Senior Engineering Manager to lead our Observability team. This role is based in Barcelona.
   

  

**Your Role within the Kingdom**
 As an Senior Engineering Manager in Runtime & Insights your responsibility is to lead and empower the Observability team, delivering tools and services that enhance the reliability and insights of our global operations. You are not only a manager but also a product visionary, guiding both the technical roadmap and product strategy to ensure exceptional user value.
   

  

 You'll lead a dedicated Observability team responsible for maintaining and advancing observability and reliability through robust logging, metrics, tracing, and profiling solutions. The products your team delivers will support developers and operational teams across King, ensuring optimal performance and health of our game platform.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with engineering teams, influencing strategies around how we monitor all King games and services across our Public Cloud footprint, while championing best practices in DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Lead, motivate and inspire a team of passionate engineers that own and operate the observability platform at King.
   

  

 Lead both technical strategy and product management within Observability, driving product vision and execution.
   

  

 Build and evolve solutions for observability leveraging Grafana (collector and dashboarding), Loki (logs), Mimir (metrics), and Pyroscope (profiling).
   

  

 Act as an ambassador for on-call practices, leveraging PagerDuty for incident management and promoting robust reliability engineering culture.
   

  

 Drive adoption and best practices for Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

 Collaborate effectively across King to understand business needs and align technical deliverables.
   

  

 Foster a supportive, inclusive team environment that nurtures career growth and team cohesion.
   

  

 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

 7+ years leading and motivating high performing engineering teams.
   

  

 Deep expertise in cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
   

  

 Strong understanding of observability tools and concepts, including metrics, logs, traces, and profiling.
   

  

 Practical experience with Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Pyroscope, and PagerDuty.
   

  

 Solid experience managing technical teams, driving product roadmaps, and managing stakeholder expectations.
   

  

 Proven leadership in creating a healthy engineering culture emphasizing collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Excellent strategic thinking, capable of independently contributing to King’s broader technology and product strategies.
   

  

**Healthy Team**
 Ability to build and maintain a structured, high-performing team with clearly defined roles aligned with strategic priorities.
   

  

 Demonstrated success in mentoring team members, fostering communication, and embedding a collaborative and service-oriented mindset.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Quantitative Python Developer to Credit Risk Team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is a leading financial services group and one of the largest employers in the Nordics and Baltics. As the banking industry evolves rapidly, we take pride in our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in navigating these changes. Does this sound like the right fit for you?
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled Quantitative Python Developer to join our Credit Risk team. You will work at the intersection of quantitative modelling, software engineering, and risk management, helping to build and maintain tools that assess, monitor, and forecast credit risk.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role you can expect to:
   

  

* Develop and maintain Python-based tools and libraries for credit risk modelling and analytics,
* Collaborate with quantitative risk analysts and model validators to ensure model accuracy and regulatory compliance,
* Design and support frameworks for capital calculation, e.g., Basel IV.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* An academic degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical field,
* Knowledge in mathematics, statistics or econometrics,
* Strong Python programming skills, with experience in scientific computing libraries such as NumPy, pandas, SciPy, and scikit-learn.
* Experience with statistical modeling, time series analysis, or machine learning,
* Experience with SQL and working with large datasets,
* Ability to translate mathematical formulas and algorithms into functional code,
* Proficiency with Git and GitHub for version control and collaborative development,
* Strong communication skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams.


 Though not explicitly required for a successful candidate, the following would be considered an advantage:
   

  

* Experience developing and maintaining python libraries,
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements (e.g., Basel III/IV, IFRS 9, CCAR),
* Previous open source contributions or active participation in developer communities,
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions or other CI/CD tools.


**What We Offer**
 We provide a wide range of experiences and benefits to our employees, and while each person’s career journey is unique, the key components that form the foundation of what we offer include:
   

  

* Challenging and meaningful work in an ambitious, highly professional, and truly awesome cross border team.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits, health insurance and other employee benefits.
* Extensive training, many learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 15th of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Olga Wohlfahrt at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Spännande möjligheter för Mjukvaruingenjörer hos Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*
**Din roll**
 I ett nära samarbete med engagerade kollegor kommer du att ställas inför varierande och utmanande uppgifter och din roll kommer att omfatta hela produktcykeln – från design, kodning till testning och implementering.
   

  

 Vår arbetskultur på Saab präglas av ett seriöst, långsiktigt och förtroendebaserat tillvägagångssätt. Vi värdesätter att ha roligt tillsammans och tror på att bygga starka och hållbara relationer. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller om du är en erfaren specialist inom ditt område, är det viktigaste att du delar vår passion för utveckling och ny teknologi.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Har du kunskap inom någon av dessa områden; C++, Java, Python och Linux? Vi är intresserade av att lära känna just dig! Vad driver dig och vad vill du utvecklas inom? På vårt kontor i Järfälla erbjuder vi en bred variation av spännande möjligheter inom mjukvaruutveckling. Vi söker personer för roller som –
 ***mjukvaruutvecklare, mjukvaruingenjörer, devops-ingenjörer, testingenjörer och Scrum masters.***
 Vi värdesätter egenskaper som nyfikenhet, starkt driv och förmågan att effektivt kommunicera och samarbeta. Vi ser att du har en relevant högskole – eller civilingenjörsexamen, tillsammans med flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

*Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och gör ditt intresse för teknik till verklighet hos Saab!*

title: Data Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial
   

  

 ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Data Pipeline Expert with a track record of +4 years building ingestion and transformation frameworks that can handle large, fast-growing datasets with ease on AWS and Redshift, to join our
 *B2B Data & Analytical* 
 team
 *within IT B2B Billing and Data Services* 
 . The team is today responsible for the development in larger technology programs and projects supporting our B2B customer needs.
   

  

 As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data pipelines and data products. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other engineers to deliver high-quality, reliable, and efficient data solutions that power business intelligence and analytics initiatives. To succeed in this role, you have a passion for agility, maintain a positive attitude and have the ability to create strong team spirit and relationships across functional teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data using Snowflake, Redshift, dbt, Apache Airflow and other cloud-based technologies.
* Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand data needs and design appropriate solutions.
* Build and maintain data models, ensuring data is accurate, consistent, and easily accessible for analytics and reporting.
* Implement modern data transformation tools and frameworks (e.g., dbt, Apache Airflow) to streamline data processing workflows.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues, ensuring high reliability and data quality.

title: Microsoft Data Architect
description:
HCLTech is seeking a Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE Data Migration / Data Integration Lead to join their award winning and growing team.
 



  





 This individual’s primary responsibility will be to demonstrate a clear approach to Migration and integration efforts within the project team.
 



  





 The candidate must be able to work closely with different personality types and skillsets, be detail-oriented, and be meticulously organised. In addition, success requires the candidate to be able to prioritize multiple demands in a fast-paced environment.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Architect
* Strong expertise in data modelling, database design, and data integration techniques.
* Proficiency in database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB).
* Knowledge of data governance frameworks, data quality management, and data security.
* Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Certifications in data management or data architecture (e.g., CDMP, DAMA) are a plus.



  





**Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Data Strategy Development: Development: Collaborate with business stakeholders to define data strategy and align it with organizational goals. Develop a roadmap for data architecture and identify opportunities for data optimization and enhancement.
* Data Modelling and Design: Design and develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models to meet business requirements. Ensure data models are aligned with industry standards, best practices, and data governance policies.
* Data Integration: Define data integration strategies and implement data integration processes to consolidate and synchronize data from various sources. Develop and maintain data integration pipelines, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and reliability.
* Data Governance and Quality: Establish data governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance. Implement data quality control measures to identify and resolve data issues.
* Database Management: Oversee the design, implementation, and management of databases, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and reliability. Evaluate and recommend appropriate database technologies and tools.
* Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, business intelligence teams, and software developers, to understand data requirements and provide technical guidance. Communicate data architecture and design decisions effectively to stakeholders.
* Emerging Technologies: Stay updated with emerging trends and technologies in data management, analytics, and cloud computing. Evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools that can enhance the organization's data capabilities.



  





**Essential Functions** 








* Assist the Technical Architect in designing technical solutions to meet customer requirements across the D365 solution.
* Assist the Technical Architect in designing integrations between D365 applications and legacy/third party systems using multiple technologies, including Azure Logic Apps, Power Apps, Azure Data Factory, Fabric and SSIS.
* Take part in, and in some cases lead, workshops with the customer to gather technical requirements with a view of ensuring technical solutions meet the customers’ requirements within the guidelines of the technical solution set out by the Technical Architect.
* Report to the Technical Architect and/or Project Manager on a regular basis with updates on progress, risks/challenges and resourcing requirements.
* Write Technical Design Documents detailing how technical solutions should be built so development teams can carry out the builds.
* Write Integration Design Documents detailing how integration solutions should be built so development teams can carry out the builds.
* Lead the development team, deciding on priorities for delivery and managing resources to deliver solutions in a timely manner to support the project
* Be responsible for Quality Assurance of developments delivered by the development team, carrying out code reviews and best practice checks and ensuring quality delivery
* Aid with regular quality audits for Implementation Programmes related to D365 CE
* Assist the REM team with deployment of releases to customer environments
* Manage development resources during SIT/SAT and UAT cycles to ensure proper levels of support including managing priorities and workloads of the team
* Attend regular meetings with the Leads of all technical teams on the project to ensure all teams are working towards a singular goal
* Mentor members of the development team to improve their skills
* Contribute to Best Practice processes







**Required Skills and Experience** 








* Proficient/Skilled at PowerShell development
* Proficient/skilled in Dev Ops ALM components/Release process
* Proficient/Skilled at Azure Logic App Development
* Proficient/Skilled in Azure components such as Azure Key Vault, On-Premise Data Gateway, Azure Monitor
* Proficient/Skilled at Power Apps/DataVerse Development
* Proficient/Skilled at SQL scripting/development.
* Detailed understanding of security design principles for both D365 CE and Azure components, including the mechanisms for authorisation and interaction with these components.
* Skilled at writing detailed technical documentation in a clear and concise manner.
* A detailed knowledge of DevOps/Git and general rules/processes for development/source controls.
* Great communication skills to enable clear and consistent communications with both members of the Technical team and also with Functional Consultants and customers’ staff
* Good leadership skills: must be able to lead a team, manage timelines and priorities, and take responsibility for deliverables.



  





*HCL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, or status with regard to public assistance.*

title: Senior mjukvaruingenjör inbyggda system
description:
Evidente i Stockholm växer och vi söker nu riktigt duktiga programmerare som vill jobba med utveckling av inbyggda system.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Vi erbjuder stor bredd och omväxling i dina uppdrag, både med avseende på arbetsuppgifter och på bransch. Våra kunder finns inom fordon, industri medicinteknik och telekom . Vi har lika delar uppdrag inne på kontoret och ute på plats hos våra kunder. Ett typiskt uppdrag är ett helhetsåtagande där vi arbetar i grupp och levererar resultat till kunden.
 



  





 Vårt strukturerade arbetssätt i kombination med våra erfarna och duktiga kollegor ger dig utmärkta verktyg att nå resultat och utveckla dig själv. Som anställd på Evidente finns även möjligheter att delta i spännande uppdrag hos i Göteborg och Lund. Samt arbeta med våra andra discipliner systemutveckling och management consulting. Gemensamt för oss alla är att vi arbetar med produktutveckling av inbyggda system.
 



  





 Som programvaruingenjör på Evidente arbetar du brett med programvara. Fokus ligger givetvis på kodning och kodkvalitet, men vi arbetar förutom implementering även med metodutveckling, arkitektur, felsökning, granskning och uppdragsledning. Hos oss på Evidente arbetar du med utveckling av inbyggda system i alla faser från koncept till färdig produkt. Vi erbjuder dig intressanta arbetsuppgifter och mycket god gemenskap.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi tror du drivs av ett genuint och starkt teknikintresse. Du har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande och erfarenhet inom utveckling av inbyggda system. Vi tror att du vill arbeta med board bring-up, nya processorer, plattformar och en stor bredd av olika användningsområden.
 



  





 Erfarenhet inom något av följande områden är meriterande:
 


* C/C++ eller annat programspråk som Rust
* Baremetal, bootloader, OS och applikation
* Embedded Linux
* Realtids- och säkerhetskritiska system
* Kommunikationsprotokoll t.ex. CAN/CANopen



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och värdesätter god kommunikationsförmåga. Du är en drivande och självgående person som ser fram emot utmaningen att överträffa våra kunders förväntningar.
 



  





 Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
 



  





**Evidente** 




 Evidente är ett privatägt ingenjörsföretag startat 1996. Vi erbjuder tjänster inom mjukvaruutveckling och systemutveckling samt management consulting, och riktar oss till företag inom MedTech, automotive och industri som har produkter med inbyggda system.
 



  





 Det är inte det mest spännande sättet att presentera ett företag, vi vet. Men så är spänning heller inte en del av vårt erbjudande. Vi är trygga och pålitliga på gränsen till tråkiga. Vad vi kan tillföra ett projekt är expertis, proaktivitet och noggrannhet kryddat med ett passionerat driv.
 



  





 Fokus för verksamheten är att erbjuda våra kunder en komplett åtagande gällande produktutveckling. Vårt dagliga arbete är präglat av struktur och leveransfokus för att kunna erbjuda högsta kvalitet till såväl kunder, leverantörer som kollegor. Kvalificerade medarbetare är vår största tillgång och de flesta av oss är civilingenjörer med lång yrkeserfarenhet.
 



 För mer information om Evidente Sweden AB besök https://www.evidente.se/
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Huvudplaceringsort: Stockholm
 



 Kontor: Warfvinges väg 32, Kungsholmen
 



 Omfattning: Tillsvidareanställning heltid
 



 Kollektivavtal och pension: Självklart
 



 Startdatum: Enligt överenskommelse
 



  





**Ansök** 
 via LinkedIn eller epost till jobb@evidente.se, vänligen skriv "Stockholm mjukvaruingenjör" i ämnesraden. Vi går igenom urvalet och rekryterar löpande. Vill du veta mer eller har frågor kontaktar du: Simon Colbing, teknikområdeschef, +46709124291.

title: Spännande möjligheter för Systemingenjörer hos Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting

Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld. Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

*Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och gör ditt intresse för teknik till verklighet hos Saab!*

title: Senior/Staff Data Engineer (Rust), Singapore Based
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

 Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel
   

  

 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world
   

  

 Get to Know Our Team
   

  

 At Agoda, our Data Store Team operates at massive scale—across multiple data centers, handling millions of writes per second and managing tens of petabytes of data. We tackle complex challenges in real-time data ingestion, replication, enrichment, storage, and analytics. Join us to build world-class tools and provide robust S3 object store and block storage solutions for our users.
   

  

 The Opportunity
   

  

 We are seeking talented engineers with diverse backgrounds and experience levels to join our Data Store Team. Whether you are an experienced specialist or early in your data engineering journey, we encourage you to apply. We value engineers who are curious, adaptable, and passionate about building scalable systems. If you are excited by the challenge of working with massive data platforms, enjoy solving complex problems, and want to make a real impact on how data is stored and accessed at scale, this is the opportunity for you. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to building an inclusive, innovative team.
   

  

 In this Role, you will get to:
   

  

* Enhance the monitorability, scalability, stability, accuracy, speed, and efficiency of our data storage systems
* Design and develop authentication systems
* Build and maintain load balancers
* Automate operational processes to improve reliability and reduce manual effort
* Develop front-end and other utility tools to support internal users
* Work primarily with Rust, and occasionally with other languages such as Go, Python, and TypeScript
* Participate in an on-call rotation (approximately one week per month) to address emergency issues—though we prioritize minimizing such incidents


 What You’ll need to Succeed
   

  

* Passion for coding and building robust systems
* Expert-level proficiency in Rust programming
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Experience debugging and resolving production issues
* Familiarity with Big Data technologies and tools
* Systems administration experience in Linux environments


 It's great if you have
   

  

* Experience working with data infrastructure or data platform teams
* Background in open-source product development
* Experience with big data ecosystems
* Familiarity with Kubernetes


 Rewards & Benefits
   

  

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
* Opportunity to work on large-scale, high-impact engineering challenges
* Collaborative, international team environment
* Professional growth and learning opportunities
* Flexible work arrangements and generous leave policies
