title: Graduate Commercial Strategy Associate (Fixed-term, 12 months)
description:
**Company Description**  

Meet Unit4. With over 40 years of heritage, we’re an agile, fast growing, Cloud company that is on a mission to redefine Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) for mid-market people-centric organizations.


With our innovative, self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software, our customers can spend more time on meaningful high-value work. At the heart of what we do lies a simple yet profound purpose: Improve how people work by focusing on what truly matters. — A powerful statement that enables different priorities for different people.


We’re shaping how work should feel, and we empower our people by providing them with the right tools to achieve the autonomy they need - it's what makes us unique.

 **Job Description**  

This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys solving problems in real time. As a Graduate Commercial Strategy Associate, you’ll work directly with the Head of ERPx Commercial Strategy & Growth to help scale ERPx as a core growth engine. You’ll be parachuted into cross-functional teams to help build processes, align priorities, and drive execution—whether that’s refining go-to-market strategy, resolving friction points, or supporting commercial initiatives. This is a “do-er” role for someone who wants to learn by doing and contribute meaningfully from day one.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Parachute into cross-functional teams to help build and operationalize strategic initiatives across Sales, Product, Marketing, and Customer Success.
* Support the design and rollout of ERPx’s go-to-market strategy, ensuring alignment across value proposition, pricing, reference strategy, partner execution, and in-market delivery.
* Build and manage recurring processes that keep teams aligned and accountable.
* Identify friction points or misalignments across functions, and propose structured, data-backed solutions to bridge them.
* Develop dashboards, reporting mechanisms, and analysis that inform leadership decisions on ERPx’s growth and scalability.
* Conduct research and analysis to identify opportunities and support commercial positioning.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 1–3 years in consulting, business strategy, operations, or related analytical roles (internships or analyst experience welcome).
* Strong problem-solving skills, comfort with data, and ability to translate insights into clear actions.
* Experience working across multiple teams or functions, with demonstrated ability to drive alignment.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, able to present complex ideas for diverse audiences.
* Interest in ERP, SaaS, or enterprise technology.

**Why Join Us?**


This is more than a graduate role—it’s a launchpad into enterprise strategy. You’ll be embedded in a high-performing team driving one of the company’s most important growth engines: ERPx. You’ll work directly with senior leaders, gain exposure to global commercial strategy, and help shape how innovation in product, AI, services, and delivery comes together in-market.


We’re looking for curious, driven individuals who want to learn by doing, thrive in ambiguity, and are ready to make an impact from day one.

**What We’re Looking For**

* A bias for action, someone who doesn’t just analyze but builds.
* Comfort parachuting into new teams, quickly understanding context, and helping drive progress.
* A collaborative mindset with the confidence to challenge assumptions and propose solutions.
* A passion for enterprise technology and how it transforms industries.

  

**Additional Information**  

Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us

  

At Unit4, we offer:

* a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
* balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
* talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
* a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
* a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

title: Information Security Engineer
description:
As an Information Security Engineer at OX2, you are a key enabler of the energy transition by safeguarding our people, systems, and infrastructure. You strengthen OX2’s security capabilities across Europe, ensuring compliance, resilience, and trust in our operations. By combining technical expertise with curiosity and creativity, you ensure that security is not a barrier but a driver of innovation and growth.


Together with colleagues across IT, Operations, and Business Development, you will implement, operate, and continuously improve our security posture, making a tangible contribution to Europe’s sustainable future.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Deploy and manage security tools (SIEM, EDR, firewalls, vulnerability scanners).
* Implement secure configurations and enforce security policies.
* Configure and maintain identity management and conditional access policies.
* Ensure compliance with standards (ISO 27001, NIST, NIS2).
* Conduct vulnerability assessments and remediate identified risks.
* Monitor alerts, manage incidents, and coordinate with SOC providers.
* Deliver security awareness training and build practical guidance for teams.
* Promote a culture where security is seen as an enabler across the organization.


**Qualifications:**

* 2+ years’ experience in security operations or IT security.
* Hands-on experience with security tools and vulnerability management.
* Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.
* Relevant academic background is valuable, but emphasis is placed on your expertise, curiosity, and ability to learn quickly.


**Other:**

* Experience in energy or critical infrastructure is an advantage.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Azure security and cloud tools is beneficial.
* Security certifications (or willingness to pursue) are valued.
* Understanding of OT/IT security is a plus.
* Passionate about security as an enabler of the renewable energy transition.

  

  

**About OX2**


OX2 develops, constructs, sells, owns, and operates renewable energy solutions at scale. OX2’s project development portfolio consists of in-house developed as well as acquired projects in onshore and offshore wind, solar, and energy storage, in various phases of development. OX2 operates across Europe and in Australia. The company has about 500 employees and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. OX2 is owned by EQT, one of the world’s largest private equity investors. www.ox2.com

title: Instructional Designer - Sales Enablement
description:
**Who we are is what we do.**


Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.


Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

**Why should you be part of our success story?**


As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.


Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.


Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

**Position Overview**
---------------------


The Enablement team at Deel is looking for an experienced Instructional Designer to turn sales and product complexity into clear, actionable learning that drives performance across our global Sales teams.


This role is more than course-building—it’s about creating enablement programs that deliver sales outcomes: faster ramp, stronger win rates, and higher product adoption. You’ll work closely with Sales Enablement Managers, Sales Leaders, and Product teams to design content that supports everything from product launches to competitive positioning to objection handling.


We’re looking for someone who can create content that delivers business impact, and design with the seller in mind—while moving fast and staying flexible in a high-growth, global environment.

**What You’ll Do**
------------------

* Partner with **Sales Enablement Managers, Sales Leaders, and Product stakeholders** to identify seller needs and design content that drives measurable sales outcomes.
* Create **sales enablement content** such as playbooks, talk tracks, discovery guides, product launch training, and role-based learning modules.
* Use **AI and multimedia tools** to accelerate workflows, enhance content, and deliver innovative learning experiences.
* Edit and produce **short-form videos and multimedia content** that bring sales concepts and product value propositions to life.
* Manage multiple enablement projects simultaneously, applying project management best practices to keep stakeholders aligned and initiatives on track.
* Build **reinforcement tools** (quizzes, scenarios, role-play guides) to drive long-term skill retention and behavior change.
* Capture **feedback from frontline sellers and managers** to iterate quickly and ensure enablement content stays relevant and impactful.
* Translate product complexity into **clear, seller-ready content** that improves fluency and competitive positioning.
* Design with a **global-first mindset** to ensure content is scalable and effective across regions.
* Apply **instructional design and adult learning theory** to create engaging, sales-focused learning experiences.
* **Measure impact** by tracking adoption, feedback, and sales KPIs (e.g., ramp time, win rates, product adoption), and use insights to continuously improve.

**Skills & Qualifications**
---------------------------

* 3+ years of Instructional Design experience, with at least 1–2 years supporting Sales Enablement or commercial teams in a tech environment.
* Strong writing, storyboarding, and communication skills—able to turn technical product details into **clear, compelling sales narratives**.
* Demonstrated experience creating **sales enablement content**: playbooks, discovery guides, competitive positioning, objection handling, and product training.
* Skilled in **instructional design models** (ADDIE, SAM) and able to design learning experiences that influence seller behavior.
* Proficiency with **eLearning and enablement authoring tools**, with an eye for mobile-first and accessible design (i.e.Articulate Rise, Adobe, Synthesia)
* Experience using **AI tools** to streamline design and drive innovation in learning.
* Ability to **edit and produce video and multimedia assets** to support blended learning.
* Familiarity with **project management practices and tools** to keep enablement projects organized and efficient.
* Strong understanding of **adult learning principles** and eLearning standards (SCORM, xAPI, HTML).
* Experience designing **scalable content for a global audience**.
* Proven track record of **cross-functional collaboration** with the Revenue Enablement team, Sales Leaders, and Product stakeholders.

**Total Rewards**


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

**Some things you’ll enjoy**

* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @**deel.com* *and other acquired company emails like @**payspace.com* *and @**paygroup.com**. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting**our careers page**.*  

  

*Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.*  

  

*Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.*


We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.


We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.


For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

title: Regional Vice President, Enterprise Sales
description:
Harness is a high-growth company that is disrupting the software delivery market. Our mission is to enable the 30 million software developers in the world to deliver code to their users reliably, efficiently, securely and quickly, increasing customers’ pace of innovation while improving the developer experience. We offer solutions for every step of the software delivery lifecycle to build, test, secure, deploy and manage reliability, feature flags and cloud costs. The Harness Software Delivery Platform includes modules for CI, CD, Cloud Cost Management, Feature Flags, Service Reliability Management, Security Testing Orchestration, Chaos Engineering, Software Engineering Insights and continues to expand at an incredibly fast pace.

Harness is led by technologist and entrepreneur Jyoti Bansal, who founded AppDynamics and sold it to Cisco for $3.7B. We’re backed with $425M in venture financing from top-tier VC and strategic firms, including J.P. Morgan, Capital One Ventures, Citi Ventures, ServiceNow, Splunk Ventures, Norwest Venture Partners, Adage Capital Partners, Balyasny Asset Management, Gaingels, Harmonic Growth Partners, Menlo Ventures, IVP, Unusual Ventures, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Alkeon Capital, Battery Ventures, Sorenson Capital, Thomvest Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank.

**Position Summary**

The Regional Vice President is a front line sales leader who will leads a team of Enterprise Account Executives. This role will be responsible for running a regional plan, building out the territory, developing Enterprise Account Executives within the region, while implementing a strong sales methodology, working complex enterprise sales cycles, while focused on the Harness software and services.

**Key Responsibilities**
* Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue targets
* Develop and execute a comprehensive regional plan
* Accelerate customer adoption
* Continually build and grow a robust sales pipeline
* Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption
* Lead contract negotiations
* Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Ensure customer happiness and success
* Help to recruit and build Nordics sales team

**About You**
* At least 3 years formal sales leadership experience building and leading high performance sales teams.
* High career trajectory and potential.
* Someone with experience in a start-up environment.
* Consistent overachievement in previous roles.
* Significant enterprise sales and strategic customer development experience.
* Experience practicing and implementing a sales methodology, such as MEDDIC.
* Track record in closing large, complex deals across verticals in the Fortune 500.
* History of accurate forecasting and business reporting.
* Experience in working with Salesforce and other sales oriented tracking tools.


**Work Location**


* This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden

  




### **Harness in the news:**



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin.

  

**Note on Fraudulent Recruiting/Offers**



We have become aware that there may be fraudulent recruiting attempts being made by people posing as representatives of Harness. These scams may involve fake job postings, unsolicited emails, or messages claiming to be from our recruiters or hiring managers.



Please note, we do not ask for sensitive or financial information via chat, text, or social media, and any email communications will come from the domain @harness.io. Additionally, Harness will never ask for any payment, fee to be paid, or purchases to be made by a job applicant. All applicants are encouraged to apply directly to our open jobs via our website. Interviews are generally conducted via Zoom video conference unless the candidate requests other accommodations.



If you believe that you have been the target of an interview/offer scam by someone posing as a representative of Harness, please do not provide any personal or financial information and contact us immediately at . You can also find additional information about this type of scam and report any fraudulent employment offers via the Federal Trade Commission’s website (, or you can contact your local law enforcement agency.

title: VMware Engineer
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och strukturerad VMware Engineer till en tekniktung miljö med höga säkerhetskrav. Uppdraget omfattar en omfattande migrering från en extern till en intern VMware-miljö, där fokus ligger på stabilitet, kvalitet och effektiv implementering utifrån en definierad grunddesign.


Kunden är en samhällskritisk aktör inom betalningsinfrastruktur, vilket ställer höga krav på säkerhet, samarbetsförmåga och noggrannhet.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Migrera från extern till intern VMware-miljö enligt fastställda metoder.
* Följa och förbättra migreringsrunbooks och körscheman.
* Utföra arbetsmoment utanför kontorstid vid behov (inom servicefönster).
* Hantera incidenter och säkerställa att lösningar följer IT-arkitektur och säkerhetsriktlinjer.
* Dokumentera förändringar och bidra till processutveckling.

### **Kravprofil**

* Mycket god kunskap inom VMware Cloud Foundation (vSphere, vSAN, NSX, Avi Load Balancer).
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk, Active Directory, DNS, Windows och Linux.
* Strukturerat arbetssätt och vana att dokumentera.
* Erfarenhet av incidenthantering och arbete enligt säkerhetsstandarder.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens.

### **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av arbete i säkerhetsklassad miljö.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av större VMware-migreringar.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och förbättra migreringsmetodiker och dokumentation.

### **Personliga egenskaper**


Vi söker dig som är självgående och tar initiativ, samtidigt som du har lätt för att samarbeta och kommunicera med andra. Du har ett analytiskt och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt, är kvalitetsmedveten och har ett starkt säkerhetstänk som genomsyrar ditt arbete.

 **Start**: Omgående start med hänsyn 1 månads uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare

 **Placeringsort:** Stockholm

**Ansökan:** Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match

 **Vad vi står för:**  

Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.


Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!

 **Varför ska du välja oss?**  

Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.

 *Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Senior Cloud Security Engineer
description:
Location: Gothenburg or remote in Sweden

**About the job**


We are looking for a hands-on Cloud Security Engineer to build and automate the controls that keep our cloud infrastructure, services, and data safe. You’ll partner closely with IT and all of engineering to design practical guardrails, improve identity and access management, and ensure we meet regulatory and customer expectations without slowing delivery.


This role blends modern cloud security engineering with compliance expertise. You’ll approach security and compliance like an engineering challenge. You’ll work on integrating the required controls seamlessly into our existing systems and processes in a way that won’t slow us down.


Join a supportive, collaborative organization where your ideas are valued, and teamwork is at the heart of everything we do. We believe in creating a positive, inclusive environment — and having fun while doing great work

**What you will be doing**

* Design, implement, and automate security and compliance controls across cloud, network, data, and CI/CD, with a focus on Azure and infrastructure-as-code.
* Lead IAM improvements: Least privilege by default, role design, conditional access and MFA, privileged access management, service/workload identities, and secrets management.
* Build with a “security as product” mindset: Provide security and compliance building blocks that we can re-use and apply across our infrastructure and products.
* Build controls to help us detect and respond to security incidents and policy deviations.

**Who you are**

* 5+ years implementing secure and compliant infrastructure and controls in a regulated industry.
* Infrastructure-as-code proficiency and able to work with Git-based CI/CD workflows.
* Hands-on experience making SOC 2 and/or PCI-DSS controls operate effectively and supporting audits.
* Scripting ability in Python.
* Experience with other frameworks (ISO 27001, HIPAA/HITRUST).
* Experience working with Java and/or .NET.
* Solid understanding of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) ecosystem, particularly its security and compliance-focused projects.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure’s security offerings, including tools and services for securing cloud infrastructure and ensuring compliance.

**What do we offer you?**


We are proud to offer you a workplace where we have high engagement and where creativity and curiosity is always much appreciated. Your ideas will be heard.

* Ability to schedule your calendar with flexible work locations.
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Synergy events where all Noders across meet each other to collaborate on a professional level as well as having fun which is equally as important.
* Great opportunities to develop certain skill or to learn new things with trainings. We want to support your development and dreams.

title: Bachelor Thesis - Trace Documentation Tool
description:

title: Senior Technical Project Manager
description:
**Company description** 




  





 At Nordeiq AB, we help organizations transform their business through technology by bringing together deep expertise in AI, Cybersecurity, Cloud Transformation, and Enterprise Architecture.
 



 As a boutique consulting firm, we are dedicated to being client centric, delivering every assignment with diligence and attention to detail, and ensuring that the outcomes create real, tangible value.
 



  





 Our people are at the heart of our vision to become the trusted partner for technology transformation. We are curious and eager to learn, always sharing knowledge and experience, while making sure the journey is enjoyable both within our team and alongside our clients.
 



 What sets us apart is our ability to combine high professional standards with emotional intelligence, building lasting relationships that extend beyond individual projects.
 



  





 At Nordeiq, you will be part of a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and fun team working on transformative initiatives with some of the leading enterprises in the Nordics.
 



  





**Position overview** 




  





 We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Senior Technical Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for leading teams to deliver projects that span across one or more business units, managing resources, schedules, financials, and adhering to quality control guidelines throughout the full
 
 project
 
 lifecycle.
 



  





 You will act as the bridge between technology, people and business, ensuring deliveries are not only cutting-edge but also secure and embraced by the people who use them.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 Consulting Experience
 



 You have experience and expertise that build on the existing Nordeiq team.
 



  




* More than 8 years of consulting experience working with mid-size clients or enterprise clients
* Navigates complex client organizations with a curious attitude without losing focus on the assignment
* Translates client demands and challenges into solutions that can be implemented and operated over time



  





 Technical Expertise
 


* Proven experience as a Technical Project Manager, successfully leading complex projects from initiation to delivery.
* Strong technical foundation with understanding and hands-on experience in areas such as software development, digital transformation, solution architecture, or cybersecurity.
* Ability to evaluate and recommend technical strategies, tools, and platforms that align with business needs.
* Commitment to staying current with emerging technologies and integrating them effectively where relevant.



  





 Project Management Skills
 


* Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in alignment with organizational goals.
* Develop and maintain detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets for tech initiatives.
* Manage project risks, resolve issues, and ensure timely delivery of milestones.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure alignment with business needs.
* Report project progress to leadership and recommend adjustments as needed.
* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft 365 and project management tools.



  





**Soft Skills** 




 We believe you bring the following soft skills to Nordeiq.
 



  





 Customer centric
 


* Display excellent emotional intelligence fostering a collaborative, supportive and productive environment
* Keep client’s business goals in focus and aligns solutions to meet these



 Communication skills
 


* Practices active listening to understand client needs and asks questions to provide adopted advice and solutions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills combined with presentation skills to convey complex tech-information to non-technical stakeholders



 Problem solving
 


* Applies analytical thinking to break down complex matters into solvable pieces
* Offers innovative solutions balancing business demands with tech, cost and people constrains

title: SecOps Engineer
description:
**Would you like to be a part of our team as we move towards a fossil freedom?**
 For the Vattenfall IT we are now looking for an experienced and ambitious
 **SecOps Engineer** 
 who will enjoy a fast-developing international working environment.
   

  

**Our environment**
 Because of fast growing security developments and threats, we want to enhance our security organization by increasing operational security in our delivery units. To realize this ambition, we set up a technically oriented Security Operations Team (SecOps) focusing on implementing security related improvements for the whole IT landscape.
   

  

 The SecOps department is an international team of IT engineering colleagues representing different competence areas. We follow security trends, identify vulnerabilities and security findings and above all, focus on implementing improvements. One of the key competences within SecOps services is data encryption and key management. In order to provide high quality services within Vattenfall‘s IT landscape we continue development of this area. As a result we keep our team growing and we’re looking for a new colleague who will help us in this journey.
   

  

**Your Job as SecOps Engineer**
 We are looking for a talented and motivated person with security mindset. As a SecOps Engineer you will continuously work on improvement of Vattenfall’s security posture by contribution in tasks like mitigation of challenging vulnerabilities, work on defined key risk indicators, isolation of unsupported OS, etc.
   

  

 You will work with various teams on harmonization of IT security processes, automation of daily tasks and security implementations.
   

  

**Your Key Activities Will Be**
* Coordinate security implementations (i.e. vulnerability mitigations) for data center environment
* Monitor globally defined Key Risk Indicators and mitigate them
* Create automation usecases (Automation Zone)
* Isolation of servers with unsupported OS (LCM) management core infrastructure
* Proactively look for the most critical vulnerabilities and drive mitigation process
* Security reporting analysis in order to mitigate compliancy/security misconfiguration
* Act as a SME for security topics to other Teams
* Follow/analyze Vattenfall Security Standards and internal IT processes to harmonize work among different platforms and environments (\*NIX/Windows, on-prem/cloud)
* Stay informed about recent developments on new security technologies and assess their applicability to the organization
* Provide technical guidance and training to other team members
* Develop and maintain SecOps internal and external knowledge base
* Participate in projects, audits and compliance assessments


**You Will Also Contribute In**
* Support Data Centre Teams with coordination of security topics.
* Support Automation Team with development of automation scripts and use cases
* Cooperate with AppOps Team to work on evergreen update solutions for applications
* Helping to define security baselines and initiate changes
* Support the line organization with execution and broaden IT Security knowledge
* Support SecOps internal Team members in other areas like firewall implementation process for cloud or data security topics (HSM)


**Qualifications**
**Our ideal candidate**
 Will you become our SecOps Expert and help us become fossil free in one generation?
   

  

 Are You Driven By Technical And Security Challenges And Have a Strong Desire To Enable Your Team To Consistently Improve And Deliver Efficient, Stable, Compliant, And Secure Services? Furthermore You Bring
   

  

* Experience in SecOps or cybersecurity roles, specifically within data center environments.
* Knowledge of data center infrastructure (servers, storage, networking) and its associated security requirements.
* Understanding of data center network security, including VPNs, firewalls, and access control mechanisms
* Experience with cloud based or on-prem environments
* Administrative experience of Windows/\*NIX operating systems
* Experience with vulnerability management tools and techniques, including patch management and vulnerability scanning
* Excellent problem-solving and very good analytical and conceptual skills
* Strong and effective communication and collaboration skills
* Independent, structured and systematic way of working and enjoy working in a team in an interdisciplinary environment
* Very good written and spoken English
* Willingness to undertake occasional business trips
* Familiarity with NSX-T virtualization technology
* Scripting in Python/Ansible


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our contribution towards fossil freedom**
**In Vattenfall IT, We**
* Accelerate digitalization and innovation
* Create customer value in a close business and IT partnership to reach a vision of a future where everyone can choose fossil free ways to move, make and live.
* Promote the mindset and behavior to establish a learning culture and positive digital mindset


 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of age, religion, gender identity & expression, sexual identity, disability and ethnic background.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer an exciting and challenging job where you work close to business as well as to technology. You will have the chance to broaden your area of expertise even more and gain a solid understanding of the energy utility business as well. Vattenfall wants to be your employer of choice and offers excellent primary and fringe benefits. Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a great work atmosphere, hybrid working and an excellent work-life balance. We want to be the best in what we do. We offer good remuneration, attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional growth.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Solna)/Katowice or remotely in Poland. Some travel between locations is part of the job.
   

  

**Our Organization**
 Energy is our contribution to quality of life – day after day. With around 20,000 colleagues Vattenfall provides comprehensive electricity and heating offerings to several million customers in northern Europe. For the work ahead we need people who are fully dedicated to our customers and to a sustainable society – people like you.
   

  

 Vattenfall IT is the internal provider of IT for the entire Vattenfall Group. With 1.400 employees located in Germany, Poland, The Netherlands and Sweden, we contribute to our international business success. Every day, we deliver to make sure that Vattenfall runs ever more effectively and efficiently. We drive initiatives for Vattenfall through collaboration: within Strategic Development; with our colleagues in the business; and with outside partners. Trust from our stakeholders; holistic perspective; and strong competence are key assets and critical success factors.
   

  

**More Information**
 For further information regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Marta Jura - marta.jura@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Please apply directly with your English CV through our website.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to enable the fossil freedom that drives society forward and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: IT Manager – Business Application Domain
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**IT Manager – Business Applications**
 Location: Stockholm
   

  

**Own the Future of Business Applications at Arrive**
 Are you a seasoned IT leader who thrives on transformation, building trust across the business, and delivering real outcomes through technology?
   

  

 At
 **Arrive** 
 , we’re scaling fast—and we’re looking for an
 **IT Manager** 
 to lead our
 **Business Applications domain** 
 during a critical phase of growth. This is a
 **senior leadership role** 
 , ideal for someone who brings a rare blend of technical depth, operational insight, and human-centered leadership. If you've shaped IT delivery in
 **tech-driven or high-growth organizations** 
 , led application teams across
 **Customer Care, ERP, or Middleware** 
 , and know how to align business needs with IT execution—this could be your next move.
   

  

**What You’ll Lead And Deliver**
 Strategic Leadership & Transformation
   

  

* Own and drive the transformation of our SaaS application landscape to support scalable, efficient operations.
* Define and implement an effective IT delivery model—bridging the gap between business requirements and system execution.
* Build trust with business stakeholders, creating partnerships that encourage shared ownership—not just handover.


**Tech & Application Management**
* Lead a cross-functional team across Customer Care systems, ERP, and middleware applications, balancing operations and development.
* Maintain a dynamic 12-month roadmap focused on high-impact priorities and continuous improvement.
* Guide application lifecycle management, support models, and platform governance.


**Stakeholder & Relationship Building**
* Be the go-to leader who translates business goals into technical roadmaps and delivers them.
* Build meaningful relationships across functions, fostering empathy, collaboration, and a shared sense of purpose.
* Act as the senior escalation point for internal and external partners.


**Performance, Innovation & Growth**
* Define and track KPIs, SLAs, and OKRs aligned with strategic business outcomes.
* Champion innovation and automation within the business applications landscape.
* Lead retrospectives and feedback cycles to continuously evolve how we work and deliver.


**Governance, Risk & Compliance**
* Ensure applications and vendors meet compliance standards across security, data privacy, and audit readiness.
* Oversee vendor performance, contracts, and budget ownership.


**What You Bring**
* Senior IT leadership experience in business transformation, ideally in a tech, SaaS, or high-growth organization.
* Proven background managing Customer Care systems, ERP platforms or middleware - across both operations and development.
* Strong capability in translating complex business needs into actionable technical strategies.
* Deep understanding of enterprise SaaS, integration, and application governance models.
* Natural relationship-builder. Empathetic, curious, and trusted by stakeholders.
* A leader who takes ownership, builds delivery frameworks, and inspires others to do the same.


**Why Join Arrive?**
 At
 **Arrive** 
 , technology is not just a function—it’s a force for connection, scale, and progress. We’re creating the structures that will carry us into the next phase of our journey, and this role sits right at the heart of that mission.
   

  

**You’ll Join**
* A collaborative and ambitious team with the autonomy to shape your domain.
* A company where IT is seen as a strategic enabler, not just a service.
* A fast-paced environment where curiosity, accountability, and innovation are valued.


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: AI Transformation Consultant
description:
**Company Description** 




 At Nordeiq AB, we help organizations transform their business through technology by bringing together deep expertise in AI, Cybersecurity, Cloud Transformation, and Enterprise Architecture.
 



 As a boutique consulting firm, we are dedicated to being client centric, delivering every assignment with diligence and attention to detail, and ensuring that the outcomes create real, tangible value.
 



  
 



 Our people are at the heart of our vision to become the trusted partner for technology transformation. We are curious and eager to learn, always sharing knowledge and experience, while making sure the journey is enjoyable both within our team and alongside our clients.
 



 What sets us apart is our ability to combine high professional standards with emotional intelligence, building lasting relationships that extend beyond individual projects.
 



  
 



 At Nordeiq, you will be part of a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and fun team working on transformative AI initiatives with some of the leading enterprises in the Nordics.
 



  





**Position Overview** 




 At Nordeiq, we are seeking a dynamic AI Transformation Consultant who combines technical AI expertise with strong adoption and change management skills. In this role, you will help our clients move from AI pilots to enterprise-wide adoption, guiding them through design, deployment, and cultural adoption of AI solutions that create measurable business value.
 



  





 You will act as the bridge between technology, business, and compliance, ensuring AI solutions are not only cutting-edge but also secure, compliant with EU AI Act/GDPR, and embraced by the people who use them.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




  





**Consulting Experience** 




 You have experience and expertise that build on the existing Nordeiq team. 
 



  





 • More than 8 years of consulting experience working with mid-size clients or enterprise clients 
 



 • Navigates complex client organizations with a curious attitude without losing focus on the assignment 
 



 • Translates client demands and challenges into solutions that can be implemented and operated over time
 



  





**Technical Expertise** 




 • Guide and lead the design, development, and implementation of AI tools and Agentic AI solutions
 



 • Evaluate and recommend AI technical strategies, tools, and platforms that fit projects aligned with business needs.
 



 • Collaborate with technical teams to ensure scalable and maintainable AI solutions.
 



 • Stay up to date with emerging AI technologies and integrate them where applicable.
 



  





**AI Adoption and Change Management Skills** 




 • Map AI strategy to business goals, operating models, and measurable KPIs.
 



 • Apply proven change frameworks (ADKAR, Kotter’s 8-step, Prosci) specifically to AI and automation initiatives.
 



 • Ensure AI governance and compliance with the EU AI Act, GDPR, security standards, and responsible AI principles.
 



 • Build and nurture an AI Champions Network across business units to accelerate adoption.
 



 • Design and deliver training and upskilling programs, including AI academies, Copilot promptathons, and peer-to-peer learning.
 



 • Drive value realization by linking AI adoption to tangible outcomes such as time savings, productivity gains, and financial impact.
 



 • Track and report change metrics—adoption rates, Copilot-assisted hours, ROI calculators, and KPIs like efficiency, time savings, and productivity improvements.
 



 • Collaborate with stakeholders to capture requirements and align AI initiatives with business needs.
 



 • Provide leadership with progress updates and recommend adjustments to ensure successful delivery.
 



  





**Soft Skills** 




 We believe you bring the following soft skills to Nordeiq.
 



  





 Customer centric
 


* Display excellent emotional intelligence fostering a collaborative, supportive and productive environment
* Keep client’s business goals in focus and aligns solutions to meet these



 Communication skills
 


* Practices active listening to understand client needs and asks questions to provide adopted advice and solutions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills combined with presentation skills to convey complex tech-information to non-technical stakeholders



 Problem solving
 


* Applies analytical thinking to break down complex matters into solvable pieces
* Offers innovative solutions balancing business demands with tech, cost and people constrains

title: ServiceNow Consultant
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 In this role you can expect to:
   

  

* Work closely with customers to research, design, develop and deliver innovative solutions to improve their business processes
* Assists ServiceNow Business Analyst in estimating release level of effort. Makes recommendations which yield a more cost-effective product and better streamlined workflows
* Responsible for the overall design of the application and enable innovative solutions to drive process automation across IT Services on ServiceNow Platform
* Assist or drive design workshops across projects to work with other IT streams to improve the platform adoption and user experience of ServiceNow
* Ability to prepare prototypes in demo instances for proposed solutions
* Analyzing ServiceNow releases and upgrades and how it impacts the current features and applications in use
* Design and architect ServiceNow CMDB, discovery jobs, and automation workflows and flow using ServiceNow Orchestrator
* Create ServiceNow reports and dashboards
* Support with Pre-Sales activities and responding to RFP’s and RFI’s
* Help and support Junior Consultants to grow within the ServiceNow area


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Have several years of technical and functional experience with ITIL Service Management processes
* Have several years of experience designing, developing, testing, implementing and maintaining ServiceNow platform and integrations
* ServiceNow Certified System Administrator
* Additional ServiceNow suite certifications is a plus
* Exceptional interpersonal, communication, facilitation and influencing skills
* Requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision
* Have strong supplier management skills to help provide direction and ensure quality of services
* Experience in managing an application, Agile/Scrum skills, ITIL Practitioner
* Demonstrable experience with the use of MS Office applications: Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Project, Visio.
* Knowledge of web-based systems architecture, service-based architecture, enterprise application architecture and worked integration with other applications
* Experience in designing/developing/configuring architecture for ServiceNow modules/features as a minimum (ITSM, ITOM, HR, SAM, ITBM, CSM, FSM, SecOps, GRC, Orchestration)
* Experience within Multi Service Provider (MSP) solutioning based on ServiceNow
* Understanding of the key technologies relevant to the ServiceNow integration solutions including: SSO, SAML, SSL, Web Services, LDAP, JDBC, ODBC, REST, SCP, FTPS, JSON, SOAP
* General Understanding of Database technologies such as SQL, MySQL, Oracle
* Experience in planning and execution of ServiceNow upgrades
* ITIL Certified
* Knowledge in Swedish and a valid working permit for Sweden are required


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. You might also be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which will then be a condition of undertaking the role.*
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Chef Infrastructure, Cloud & Cybersecurity – OKQ8 Tech
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Som Chef Infrastructure, Cloud & Cybersecurity erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att ta ett övergripande ansvar för att leda, utveckla och säkerställa en modern säker och kostnadseffektiv infrastruktur i både Sverige och Danmark. Rollen omfattar både vår infrastruktur och IT-drift, våra molntjänster och vårt cybersäkerhetsarbete.
   

  

 Du leder ett team på ca 6 medarbetare samt konsulter och ansvarar även för leverantörsstyrning av externa driftpartners. Teamet är uppdelat på två grupper; Infrastructure & Cloud samt Cybersecurity. Rollen är både strategisk och operativ, med tydligt fokus på att bygga en säker, skalbar och framtidssäkrad plattform med tydliga processer - du sätter riktningen men är inte rädd att själv kliva in när det behövs.
   

  

 Du rapporterar till Head of Infrastructure, Operations & Support, har eget budgetansvar och ingår i ledningsgruppen för sektionen.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Personalansvar för specialister
* Leda och utveckla teamet inom infrastruktur och cybersäkerhet
* Säkerställa en stabil, säker och kostnadseffektiv IT-infrastruktur (on-prem och cloud)
* Ansvara för molnstrategi och drift i en hybridmiljö (främst Azure)
* Utveckla och driva organisationens cybersäkerhetsarbete
* Ansvara för sourcing, upphandlingar och styrning av externa leverantörer och driftpartners
* Samverka med interna intressenter för att stödja verksamheten med stabila och skalbara lösningar
* Bidra till strategiska initiativ såsom molnmigrering, IAM-program och sourcingstrategi
* Driva projekt för att modernisera IT-miljön och förbättra processer


**Vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla organisationer inom infrastruktur och cybersäkerhet. Du har en trygg hand i att bygga säkra och framtidssäkra lösningar och är van att arbeta i både hybrid- och molnmiljöer. Din expertis inom Microsoft Azure gör att du kan driva utveckling och förflyttning till moderna plattformar som stödjer både verksamhetens behov och vår resa framåt.
   

  

**Vi ser även gärna att du även:**
* Har arbetat med outsourcingpartners och styrning av externa driftleverantörer
* Är en trygg ledare som kan driva förändring, bygga team och skapa tydliga ansvarsområden
* Är kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och trivs i en entreprenöriell kultur.
* Flytande kunskaper i engelska är ett krav


 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Sakar via
   

  

* Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Sophie Welin


**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.*
 För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i ett EU/EES-land eller ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Regeringskansliet söker en it-säkerhetsarkitekt
description:
**Sektionen för it-säkerhet, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
 Är du intresserad av att arbeta med it-säkerhet i en komplex och geografiskt spridd miljö? Vill du bidra till att Sveriges regering, Regeringskansliet och ambassader har it-system med rätt säkerhet? Vi söker nu en erfaren it-säkerhetsarkitekt.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som it-säkerhetsarkitekt arbetar du brett med it-säkerhetsfrågor och vidareutvecklar vår it-säkerhetsarkitektur för att stödja digitalisering och möta omvärldens snabba förändringar. Du samarbetar med it-säkerhetschef, specialister, team, projekt och leverantörer för att skydda information enligt överenskomna nivåer. Du håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer i omvärlden, både vad gäller hotbilder, arbetsmetoder, teknologier och produkter och utvecklar it-säkerhetsarkitektur genom att skapa en roadmap för att stärka och säkerställa it-säkerhetsförmågor i både on prem och molnmiljöer.
   

  

 Följande arbetsuppgifter ingår bl a:
   

  

* Vidareutveckla och förvalta it-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Delta i arbetet med design av och implementation av säkerhetslösningar och leda krav- och lösningsworkshoppar
* Stödja tvärfunktionella team och projekt
* Bidra till att strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för it-säkerhetsarkitektur efterlevs och kontinuerligt utvecklas


**Din bakgrund**
 Vi ser att du uppföljer följande krav:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen inom relevant område för rollen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet som it-säkerhetsarkitekt för on prem och molnmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av it-säkerhet i miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav
* Kunskap om molnlösningar och deras säkerhetsfunktioner


 Följande kunskaper och erfarenheter är meriterande:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom it-säkerhet/arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av riskhantering, sårbarhetshantering, kontinuitetsplanering och kravställning mot leverantörer
* Erfarenhet av projektledning, M365 och Azure Security-funktioner, DevSecOps
* Erfarenhet av arbete vid myndighet, offentlig sektor eller global verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av ackreditering för säkerhetsskyddsklassade informationssystem
* Kunskap om föreskrifter och standarder inom informations- och it-säkerhet (CIS, NIST, ISO 27000)
* Kunskap om NATO-regelverk och tekniska lösningar för säkerhetsskyddsklassadinformation
* Goda kunskaper inom design av IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, kryptering, åtkomst/behörighetshantering, applikationsdrift och operativsystem


**Dina egenskaper** 
 Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som motiveras av komplexa utmaningar. Du har förmåga att kommunicera säkerhetsrelaterade frågor på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt och kan arbeta mot uppsatta mål med efterfrågat resultat. Din analytiska förmåga och strategiska tankesätt gör att du självständigt och initiativtagande kan drivakomplexa projekt framåt. Du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt. Du är ansvarsfull, noggrann och strukturerad, och har god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga. Då arbetet utförs i nära samarbete med dina kollegor är viktigt att du har god samarbetsförmåga, uppskattar teamarbete och har lätt för att skapa förtroende och bygga goda relationer.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att hålla sig uppdaterad om aktuella hot och risker inom it-säkerhet. Du har god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning. Våra anställningar är placerade i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare. Beredskapstjänstgöring, resor till utlandsmyndigheter och visst arbete utanför ordinarie arbetstid kan förekomma.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast den 24 september 2025. Ansökan och personligt brev ska vara på svenska.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta sektionschef Lena Andersson Nordgren eller rekryteringsspecialist Carl Garellick. Fackliga representanter är Johan Strokirk (Saco) och Jan Wahlström (ST). Samtliga nås via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a
 **Sales Engineer** 
 at Legora, you will play a key role in bridging our product team with client-facing teams. You will be responsible for articulating the technical aspects of Legora’s platform, addressing security and architecture-related questions, configuring customer accounts, and ensuring seamless integration with our solutions. Your expertise will also help drive upsell opportunities for additional features, integrations, and API offerings.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Collaborate closely with the Go-To-Market and Customer Success teams to explain the technical capabilities and benefits of Legora to prospective and existing clients.
* Address and resolve customer queries related to security, platform architecture, AI technology, and integration workflows.
* Lead the setup and configuration of customer accounts, including Single Sign-On (SSO) and other authentication mechanisms.
* Work directly with customers to understand their requirements, design tailored solutions, and ensure a smooth deployment of the Legora platform.
* Identify and support upsell opportunities, particularly around additional features, integrations, and API capabilities.
* Act as a technical advisor during the sales process, providing best practice recommendations, assessing technical feasibility, and ensuring product alignment with customer needs.
* Maintain a deep understanding of Legora’s architecture, security standards, and AI-powered solutions to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Collaborate with the product team to share valuable insights from customer interactions, contributing to the continuous improvement of Legora’s offerings.
* Collaborate with the product team to provide feedback and insights based on customer interactions, helping to inform future product development.


 Who you are
   

  

* Knowledge of security standards and best practices, especially in AI-driven and cloud-based platforms.
* Proven experience in customer-facing technical roles, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
* Familiarity with configuring SSO and other authentication protocols.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a creative and strategic approach to technical challenges.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with internal teams and external customers.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Founding Sales Lead / Framtida Head of Sales – Cybersecurity (Remote)
description:
Molnet är framtiden – men det är också attackytan.
 



  





 Allt fler företag flyttar sin infrastruktur till molnlösningar som AWS och GCP, men få har resurser att övervaka och skydda den dygnet runt. Här kommer en Cloud SOC in: en tjänst som ger företag en dedikerad Security Operations Center för molnet, utan att de behöver bygga det själva.
 



  





 Vi står inför en enorm marknad inom cloud security & monitoring. Produkten är på plats, men vi saknar en säljmaskin. Det är här du kommer in.
 



  






 Det här är din chans att ta ägarskap över försäljningen, bygga den första kundbasen, och på sikt bli delägare (5–10% equity) och en del av founding teamet om du visar traction
 




  





**Ditt uppdrag:** 



* Äga outbound & inbound försäljning – bygg strukturer för outreach, CRM och mötesbokning som skalar
* Driva full sales cycle – boka möten, köra demos, stänga affärer
* Forma strategi & messaging – jobba nära grundaren för att sätta targeting, pitch och positionering
* Bygga playbooks – skapa processer och system för långsiktig skalbarhet
* Representera oss – bygga relationer och driva samtal på C-level



  





**Din resa här:** 



* Fas 1: Rev-share (du får % av all MRR du tar in). Fokus: ta in de första 3–5 kunderna inom 90 dagar.
* Fas 2: När traction är bevisad byter vi till fast lön + provision och du kan få delägarskap (5–10% equity).
* Fas 3: Rollen kan växa till Head of Sales, där du bygger upp och leder teamet (om du är rätt person).



  





**Vem du är:** 



* Du har erfarenhet av att driva B2B SaaS-försäljning och stänga deals utan ett stort brand i ryggen
* Du är van vid att sälja komplexa lösningar mot CTO, CISO och ledningsgrupper
* Du är hungrig, uthållig och självgående – du bygger din egen pipeline och äger hela processen
* Bonus: kunskap inom cybersecurity eller cloud är en stor fördel



  





**Viktigt att veta:** 



* Det här är inte ett KAM-jobb med färdiga kunder
* Det är inte en roll där du får leads serverade
* Det här är en chans att bygga en säljfunktion från noll och bli delägare i ett säkerhetsbolag



  





 Är du redo att ta lead på försäljning inom enterprise cybersecurity och bygga något från grunden – remote, globalt och med ägarskap? Hör av dig.

title: Engineering Director, PKI & IoT
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for an** 
**Engineering Director, PKI & IoT !!**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 41788
   

  

 Step into a high-impact leadership role driving engineering excellence in our PKI/IoT business unit. You’ll guide global teams through influence, not hierarchy—aligning efforts, elevating quality, and delivering secure, scalable products that shape the future of connectivity.
   

  

 This is your chance to lead strategically, inspire technically, and make a global mark.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**Identity and Access Management Solutions (IAMS):**
 HID Global IAM products protect more than 85 million user identities.
   

  

 HID Global Identity and Access Management Solutions products protect more than 85 million user identities. At HID Global, we understand that no person, device, or workplace can go unprotected. This philosophy of Zero Trust drives us to create new advances in risk-based multi-factor authentication, leads us to secure user identities in converged access environments and drives the need to expand implementations with our industry-leading digital certificates and PKIaaS solution to manage them at scale.
   

  

**As our** 
**Engineering Director, PKI & IoT** 
**, you’ll support HID’s success by:**
* Leading the development and execution of the technical roadmap for the business unit, in alignment with product and business goals.
* Providing guidance on technical architecture, system design, and engineering best practices, ensuring the scalability, reliability, and security of solutions.
* Overseeing key technical decisions and ensure that teams are using appropriate tools, frameworks, and methodologies (e.g., Agile, DevOps, CI/CD).
* Staying current with emerging technologies and trends, driving innovation and continuous improvement within the engineering function.
* While engineering team members report to local leaders, the Director of Engineering is responsible for providing functional leadership and mentoring across teams within the business unit.
* Working closely with local leaders to ensure that the engineering talent aligns with the unit’s technical direction and growth objectives.
* Promoting a culture of collaboration, open communication, and shared ownership across distributed teams.
* Acting as a mentor and coach to engineering leads and senior engineers within the function, fostering a supportive and high-performing environment.
* Ensuring consistency in team development, training opportunities, and career progression across locations, in partnership with local leaders.
* Participating in the recruitment of talent, focusing on mid and senior level roles, by providing a second opinion of candidates in the final interview round.
* Partnering with product management and other cross-functional teams to define product requirements, timelines, and deliverables.
* Ensuring timely and efficient delivery of product releases, while managing trade-offs between scope, time, and resources.
* Collaborating with other engineering leaders, especially across shared product efforts, to drive consistency and reduce duplication of effort.
* Ensuring the adoption of agile methodologies, sprint planning, and efficient workflows that enable timely delivery and quick iteration.
* Establishing and continuously improving engineering processes, including code quality standards, testing, release cycles, and incident management.
* Implementing best practices for monitoring and improving performance using agreed frameworks such as DORA and SPACE
* Championing the adoption of automation, DevOps practices, and lean engineering methodologies to optimize workflows and improve productivity.
* Acting as the primary engineering point of contact for business unit leadership, providing regular updates on progress, risks, and roadmaps.
* Building strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including product, marketing, and sales teams, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.
* Working closely with location leaders to address region-specific challenges and opportunities.
* Planning investments in alignment with the directions given by the BA VP of Engineering and Innovation including but limited to site strategy and shared resources/services.
* Planning and managing the engineering budget for the business unit, ensuring efficient use of resources and alignment with business goals.
* Partnering with applicable local leaders on their resource and budget planning to ensure alignment with the Business Unit needs.
* Approving funding of Epics and Features as a Business Owner
* Ensuring that sufficient investments are done in accordance with the agreed capacity allocation guardrails (Features, Enablers, Security and Compliance, Technical Debt and Sustaining/Support)
* Collaborating with HR and recruitment teams, in partnership with local leaders, to attract, hire, and retain top engineering talent across multiple locations.


**Your Experience and Background include:**
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or related practical proven experience.
* 10+ years of experience in software development or engineering leadership roles.
* Deep understanding of software development life cycles, agile methodologies, cloud infrastructure, and system design with 10+ years of experience in these fields.
* Proven experience with large-scale systems, distributed architectures, and complex product portfolios which are consumed externally by customers and partners.
* 10+ years of experience managing and scaling engineering teams, including remote and distributed teams.
* Strong coaching and mentoring skills, with a track record of developing technical talent and fostering inclusive, collaborative team cultures by practicing servant leadership.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in a matrixed organization and managing cross-functional teams.
* Ability to align engineering efforts with business goals and drive product innovation.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience working in global teams across multiple time zones.
* Previous experience within the Identity and Access Management space, preferably focused on PQC, PKI, FIDO, OpenID, credential technologies and Credential Management.
* Strategic thinker with a passion for driving technology innovation.
* Strong advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.
* Results-oriented, with the ability to balance technical depth with business acumen.
* Ability to effectively communicate in the English language, both verbally and in writing.
* Ability to read and interpret technical journals, specifications, international technical standards, etc.


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply.
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers.
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted.


 HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com .
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: IT Technical Support - Tillfälligt uppdrag
description:
*Vill du att ditt jobb bidrar till något betydelsefullt och till att göra en verklig skillnad?*
*Vårt härliga team bestående av supporttekniker har nu möjlighet att erbjuda ett tillfälligt uppdrag/visstidsanställning från och med hösten 2025 till tidig sommar 2027. Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har erfarenhet och ett brinnande intresse för IT och vill ta chansen att prova på något nytt!*
  

  

**Om rollen**
 I din roll som IT Technical Support hos AstraZeneca kommer du att vara en del av ett team som ansvarar för att säkerställa support i högsta klass till våra användare. Du kommer att arbeta i ett lokalt team med totalt sju tekniker där fokus ligger på support på plats ute hos användaren.
   

  

 Det här är en bred teknisk roll där du dagligen kommer att mötas av nya och varierande tekniska utmaningar - ingen dag är den andra lik. I samarbete med kollegor och andra tekniska experter är det ditt uppdrag att hjälpa våra användare att få den support de behöver och känna en trygghet på vägen till lösningen på deras tekniska problem.
